story:
Who we are? 

The Acta Croatica project is a link between many historical records about people and their lives. This project is for anyone interested in exploring their family history. Through the systematic digitization and processing of various Croatian population records, we intend to create a large digital depository where you can find information about the often forgotten people who have spent their lives living in the monumental story of Croatian history.

 

 

In addition to this, the Acta Croatica project and platform strives to enable long-term storage of different materials (such as images and texts) to help leave permanent traces of the vast history of these often forgotten people.

 

 

Our vision

After centuries of aspirations for the independence of the Croatian people and state, Croatian political independence was finally achieved, but the Croatian people were overwhelmed by the threat of oblivion. In the era of consumerism and the globalization of communication, politics, and values, the issue of preserving identity and communion is one of the most important tasks of our generation.

 

 

Our vision is to become the leading online platform that will help gather the great historical stories of lesser-known people and preserve their precious family history. Our intention is to create an accessible infrastructure that will open up numerous possibilities when researching our ancestors, their lives, and their forgotten narratives.

 

You can look up information about your name and surname on our site.

 

The impact

Names and surnames are the most precious testimonies of Croatian history. They go beyond spatial, political, and legal categories and firmly weave the connections of the Croatian people to their persistence. Our names and surnames represent the bridging of time and distance by bringing awareness of the past and creating the bonds of communion between people and their family.

 

 

The distinctive name of each person is a mark that follows them throughout their life. It points to the uniqueness of human existence, and it is a permanent monument to all individuals, regardless of their social status. The name itself conceals many meanings. Names are a reflection of life's reality, and they present the knowledge and beliefs of their time. Personal names represent the real treasury of wealth of a nation's language and are the most valuable monument of the traditions and identity of a nation.

 

 

The veneration of both the genus and our ancestors are an inevitable connection to the emergence of an organized way of life. With the development of social relations, there was a rise of family names that we now call surnames. Since then, we can now follow the frequent usage of last names which nowadays carry all the cultural, linguistic, and traditional treasures of a particular nation.

 

How you can help:

We need your help to reach our fundraising goal!

Make a donation and receive perks. 

 

Other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends
  • Visit our page for more info
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Twitter

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Chi siamo - Who we are

Siamo una chiesa valdese. I valdesi sono protestanti che hanno le loro radici in epoca medievale, prima della Riforma Protestante del 1517. Oggi ci sono circa 25000 valdesi in Italia, sparsi in un centinaio di chiese nel paese. Nel mondo, la chiesa valdese è presente in Svizzera, negli Stati Uniti d'America (North Carolina), Uruguay e Argentina.

We are a Waldensian church. The Waldensians are a protestant denomination tracing back its origins to the Middle ages, before the Reformation. Today there are about 25.000 Waldesians in Italy, spread across a hundred churches around the country. In the world, the Waldesian Church is present in Switzerland, the United States (North Carolina), Uruguay and Argentina.

La nostra chiesa ha sede a Bobbio Pellice, un piccolo centro di circa 500 abitanti situato in alta Val Pellice sulle Alpi del Piemonte. Il paese sorge nel cuore delle Valli valdesi, ai confini con la Francia. È circondato dai boschi, dai pascoli e da montagne ricche di storia.

Our church is located in Bobbio Pellice, a small town of about 500 inhabitants at the very heart of the Waldesian Valleys. It is situated in the north-west corner of Italy about 35 miles west of Turin and close to the French border. The Valleys rise from the plain and finally lose themselves in the rocky heights of the Alps. They are beautiful and full of history, with their lower reaches covered with chestnut woods and their upper slopes covered with alpine pastures.

Di cosa abbiamo bisogno & cosa ottieni - What We Need & What You Get

Nel novembre 2017 abbiamo acquistato un organo Walcker 11/II+P che abbiamo successivamente montato e restaurato grazie all'opera sapiente dell'organaro Mario Marzi, ma abbiamo notato che alcune parti erano seriamente danneggiate e quindi da riparare o da sostituire. L'organo è stato originariamente costruito nel 1951 ed è dotato di due tastiere, pedaliera e 11 registri, ci sono solo una trentina di organi in tutta Italia di questo tipo, tra cui uno nella Basilica di San Pietro nella Città del Vaticano. Inoltre, a dicembre 2017 la tradizione di costruzione di organi e musica per organo in Germania è stata inclusa dall'UNESCO nella lista del Patrimonio Culturale Immateriale dell'Umanità.

In November 2017 Bobbio Pellice's Waldensian church in Italy, bought a Walcker 11/II+P mechanical pipe organ.  It was built in 1951 and it has two keyboards, pedals, eleven organ stops and four diapasons. It comes from the Evangelical church of Pforzheim, in Germany. The organ was assembled by the organ builder Mario Marzi. Later we found out that some parts were badly damaged and in need of repair. We are now looking for help to fund the restoration that has since been carried out.

Questo è parte del progetto complessivo di Adotta una Nota che mira a finanziare l'acquisto e il restauro dell'organo. Puoi saperne di più visitando il sito www.adottaunanota.it

Per ringraziarti del tuo supporto, ti invieremo dei disegni ispirati agli animali selvatici tipici delle nostre valli. In più riceverai la registrazione audio del concerto inaugurale tenuto dal maestro Walter Gatti all'organo e da Elena Saccomandi alla viola il 31 marzo 2018, concerto tenutosi per l'inaugurazione della prima stagione concertistica (ne seguiranno altre!).

Nel caso in cui non raggiungeremo il traguardo prefissato, i soldi verranno comunque usati per pagare parte del restauro e tu riceverai il tuo ringraziamento.

This is part of a wider fundraising effort called Adotta una Nota - Adopt a Musical Note - to fund the whole acquisition and restoration project of our church's pipe organ. You can read more about it in English by visiting our website at: www.adottaunanota.it.

To thank you for supporting us we will reward you with the beautiful drawings inspired by the thriving wildlife of our valleys. Also, you can receive an audio copy of the special performance held by Walter Gatti (organ) and Elena Saccomandi (viola) on March the 31st, 2018 to celebrate the inauguration of our first concert season.

If we don't reach our entire goal the funds raised will be used to pay for part of the restoration process,

L'impatto - The Impact

Stai prendendo parte ad un progetto di grande impatto per la nostra comunità;

  • Per questo progetto abbiamo raccolto 10.000€;
  • Stiamo tenendo una stagione di concerti per diffondere la cultura musicale nel territorio;
  • Useremo l'organo sia durante i servizi religiosi, sia durante i concerti aperti gratuitamente a tutti, portando in valle musicisti di talento da tutta l'Italia.

You will take part in a project with great impact throughout our community;

  • The local community has already funded the purchase of the organ from Germany, totaling 10.000 €;
  • We are currently hosting a concert season, to share the organ with everyone and spread its beautiful music throughout our valley;
  • We want to use the organ during both religious services held by our church and concerts open to everyone free of charge, bringing to our valley talented musicians from all around

La sfida - The Challenge

Il nostro primo scopo è di restaurare l'organo, se superiamo questo traguardo vogliamo dare l'opportunità a giovani musicisti di formarsi su uno strumento tecnicamente completo. A questo scopo abbiamo in mente di far partire una scuola musicale e di mettere a disposizione delle borse di studio per gli studenti più promettenti.

Our first aim is to restore the organ. If we surpass that goal, we also want to give the opportunity to young musicians to grow in their talent with a state-of-the-art instrument such as our pipe organ. In order to achieve this we plan to start a music school and provide the most promising students with scolarships.

Altri modi per aiutarci - Other Ways You Can Help

Se non te la senti di contribuire ci sono molti modi in cui puoi aiutarci, per esempio puoi:

  • Condividendo la nostra campagna con i tuoi amici e sui social network!
  • Seguici su Facebook e visita il nostro sito!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our campaign with your friends and let everyone know!
  • Follow our project on Facebook and visit our English website!

story:
Need to escape from all the Propaganda around you? Not sure where to find the nearest safe space?  Well, neither are we, but we do know Hat Bar is going to be where you can find more people with hats on their heads than hate in their hearts.

 

We plan to provide daily crafting workshops appropriate for all ages of Apogaeans where you can create your own hats and hat-related swag.  Maybe you'll stop by and get to decorate your own 3D printed mini top hat, unicorn horn, princess crown, or kitty ears.  Or will you be lucky enough to be there the day we make and decorate mini top hats from cardboard?

 

We also plan to have impromptu tea parties with finger foods, edibles, and varieties of teas.   During these parties we'll give out awesome hats to participants throughout as well.

 

We'll also have small scale sound running from 8-12 each evening.  Stop on by to enjoy our bar with daily drink specials, or our BYOD dab bar/e-nail and 420 friendly lounge.

 

Your contribution to us will directly contribute to making your Apogaea experience more amazing.  Here's what you can expect your contributions to generally go towards:

$200 in contributions to our campaign will allow for more awesome crafting accessories like fabric, glue for glue guns, puffy paint, tulle, yarn for hand made hats, etc.

$400  will also allow for a larger bar and better drink offerings.  If you want yummy drinks help us serve you something other than Fireball shots.  This target will include additional finger foods, snacks, and juices towards daytime tea parties as well.

$600 towards our goal will allow for more crafting projects and premade (mainly thrift store) hats to give away to more Apogeans all week.

Achieving our goal of $800 will allow for more camp infrastructure.  This means more lighting at night, longer sound hours (more gas for the genny), and more carports/shade structures for Apogaeans to lounge under during the hot hot days.

story:
The context

Vast plains covered by low stone hills as far as the eye can see. Yellow and brown dominate the color spectrum, except for the few fields where villagers keep pasture for their livestock…
This is Udabno, a small village located in South-Eastern Georgia, 70km away from the country’s capital city Tbilisi. The village, whose name (უდაბნო) literally means “dessert” in Georgian, was founded in one of the main desert areas of the country during the Soviet times in order to host environmental migrants from the northwestern region of Svaneti. It’s separation from other settlements, the close location with Davit Gareji monastery, and the specific character of the proud Svan people creates a very rich micro-world that leaves a mark in anyone who visits it.

Villagers live on farming and dairy exploitations and their lifestyle is usually limited to working to sustain the rest of the family. Out of the 700 people living in Udabno, around 200 are children and youngsters, but since in the village there is only one school-kindergarten, they have very limited opportunities to develop themselves, learn something beyond their school classes and discover different lifestyles.

 

Our project

The project “Udabno Rural Library” was born from the collaboration of different non-
governmental organizations from Georgia with the main aim of opening a public library and social/creative space in the village, where youngsters will be able to use as leisure and educational center for gathering after school, weekends or holidays.

We believe in the power of books, non-formal education and experiential learning, and this
new building will serve as a multi-functional space in the service of young people, as a epicenter for learning, community building, civil awareness and creativity. Besides the library, which will be main purpose of the building, we would also like to include another room (creative room) dedicated to different art related workshops, painting, music, theater, origami, photography, etc.

 

What has been done

  • Since 2014, Youth Association DRONI (Tbilisi) has implemented different local and international activities in order to bring new dimensions to the village and raise awareness towards rural development and community building. One of the most successful projects so far has been the “Udabno Rural Fest”, a festival of skills implemented in May 2015 under a long-term Erasmus+ project.
  • In early 2017, Youth Association DRONI, in collaboration with Out of Area Foundation, carried out the restoration of the first two rooms of the building (library and creative/multi-functional room). A team of volunteers was then established in order to promote the concept of Rural Library and raise funds and materials at a local level.
  • In late 2017 we held a fundraising event in one of Tbilisi’s Christmas markets, where we informed local people about our project and encouraged them to provide us with books in exchange for Christmas decorations (more than 100 books were raised then).
  • Throughout 2018, Agency of Youth Promotion and Development Compass developed a new project dedicated to developing youth work in rural communities by increasing the capacity of young leaders to become active multipliers of community engagement. In the frame of this project, we have been carrying out training sessions and intensive English language courses for young people in the village together with a local women’s association. 
  • In August 2018 we will celebrate a 10-day international youth exchange to bring local youngsters closer to the cultural realities and characteristics of other countries through a cultural fair focused on the promotion of local products, cultural heritage exchange and resources in rural areas.
  • Lastly, we are also planning a large-scale event in the format of a 2-day rural festival in October 2018, which will be the basis for an annual event held in Udabno and supported by villagers and the municipality in order to highlight the natural and cultural resources of this region.

 

Next steps

Now that the rooms have been partly restored, our aim is to equip the library and creative
space with the necessary materials and resources that will allow it to be available for the local youth. The rooms will be managed by the village council, who will appoint a management board to administrate the materials and the offer of activities. Besides, both organizations (DRONI and Compass) will support the library with human resources, appointing volunteers to lead art and language workshops with kids and youngsters.

The Library will include different leisure and educational activities (storytelling, book fair, skills workshops, training events, intercultural exchange with international volunteers, language classes, movie evenings, debates, etc.) to engage local people and create a positive image of the library and lead to positive social impact for everyone. Isn’t it exciting? :D

 

What We Need

The money from this crowdfunding will be used:

  • To buy a new door to the entrance of the two rooms, so all the materials can be kept safe.
  • Shelves, tables and chairs. We have already more than 100 books donated by individual citizens, but the two rooms are still completely empty, with no space or surface where to place them and work.
  • Heating system. Winter is very rough in Udabno’s winter, so we will need to buy a gas stove to make sure that youngsters have a proper space to keep enriching their minds, even in winter!
  • In previous restoration we couldn’t afford to change the windows, which are old and lack an isolation system. Without proper new windows, the heating system will not be of much help.
  • There is a small toilet in the building surroundings which needs to be also renovated, or else users of the library should go to their houses.
  • Projector and white screen in order to use during workshops, presentations, movie nights and other educational-leisure activities in the new creative room.
  • Music equipment (i.e. loudspeaker) and computers to implement IT courses and develop internet literacy among the youngest generation.
  • Board games, computer games, literature and textbooks in Georgian and foreign languages, DVD movies, stationary materials, maps so youngsters can use to play and spend quality time with their friends.

 

How to help us?

We know it is a challenging road, but we believe in the importance and impact that this project will bring to the local community and, specially, to the local youngsters, this is why any contribution will be highly appreciated and will with no doubt help us make a change!

If you have the possibility, we will be more than happy to meet you in the Rural Festival we will hold in Udabno on 20th of October 2018. Also, if you feel you cannot contribute economically or with tangible materials, but still share the passion for this idea and want to help us personally, contact us at goruralyouth@gmail.com, and we will provide you with all necessary information!

Thank you!
story_txt:
The context
Vast plains covered by low stone hills as far as the eye can see. Yellow and brown dominate the color spectrum, except for the few fields where villagers keep pasture for their livestock…This is Udabno, a small village located in South-Eastern Georgia, 70km away from the country’s capital city Tbilisi. The village, whose name (უდაბნო) literally means “dessert” in Georgian, was founded in one of the main desert areas of the country during the Soviet times in order to host environmental migrants from the northwestern region of Svaneti. It’s separation from other settlements, the close location with Davit Gareji monastery, and the specific character of the proud Svan people creates a very rich micro-world that leaves a mark in anyone who visits it.
Villagers live on farming and dairy exploitations and their lifestyle is usually limited to working to sustain the rest of the family. Out of the 700 people living in Udabno, around 200 are children and youngsters, but since in the village there is only one school-kindergarten, they have very limited opportunities to develop themselves, learn something beyond their school classes and discover different lifestyles.
 

Our project
The project “Udabno Rural Library” was born from the collaboration of different non-governmental organizations from Georgia with the main aim of opening a public library and social/creative space in the village, where youngsters will be able to use as leisure and educational center for gathering after school, weekends or holidays.
We believe in the power of books, non-formal education and experiential learning, and thisnew building will serve as a multi-functional space in the service of young people, as a epicenter for learning, community building, civil awareness and creativity. Besides the library, which will be main purpose of the building, we would also like to include another room (creative room) dedicated to different art related workshops, painting, music, theater, origami, photography, etc.
 

What has been done

Since 2014, Youth Association DRONI (Tbilisi) has implemented different local and international activities in order to bring new dimensions to the village and raise awareness towards rural development and community building. One of the most successful projects so far has been the “Udabno Rural Fest”, a festival of skills implemented in May 2015 under a long-term Erasmus+ project.
In early 2017, Youth Association DRONI, in collaboration with Out of Area Foundation, carried out the restoration of the first two rooms of the building (library and creative/multi-functional room). A team of volunteers was then established in order to promote the concept of Rural Library and raise funds and materials at a local level.
In late 2017 we held a fundraising event in one of Tbilisi’s Christmas markets, where we informed local people about our project and encouraged them to provide us with books in exchange for Christmas decorations (more than 100 books were raised then).

Throughout 2018, Agency of Youth Promotion and Development Compass developed a new project dedicated to developing youth work in rural communities by increasing the capacity of young leaders to become active multipliers of community engagement. In the frame of this project, we have been carrying out training sessions and intensive English language courses for young people in the village together with a local women’s association. 
In August 2018 we will celebrate a 10-day international youth exchange to bring local youngsters closer to the cultural realities and characteristics of other countries through a cultural fair focused on the promotion of local products, cultural heritage exchange and resources in rural areas.
Lastly, we are also planning a large-scale event in the format of a 2-day rural festival in October 2018, which will be the basis for an annual event held in Udabno and supported by villagers and the municipality in order to highlight the natural and cultural resources of this region.

 

Next steps
Now that the rooms have been partly restored, our aim is to equip the library and creativespace with the necessary materials and resources that will allow it to be available for the local youth. The rooms will be managed by the village council, who will appoint a management board to administrate the materials and the offer of activities. Besides, both organizations (DRONI and Compass) will support the library with human resources, appointing volunteers to lead art and language workshops with kids and youngsters.
The Library will include different leisure and educational activities (storytelling, book fair, skills workshops, training events, intercultural exchange with international volunteers, language classes, movie evenings, debates, etc.) to engage local people and create a positive image of the library and lead to positive social impact for everyone. Isn’t it exciting? :D
 
What We Need
The money from this crowdfunding will be used:

To buy a new door to the entrance of the two rooms, so all the materials can be kept safe.

Shelves, tables and chairs. We have already more than 100 books donated by individual citizens, but the two rooms are still completely empty, with no space or surface where to place them and work.

Heating system. Winter is very rough in Udabno’s winter, so we will need to buy a gas stove to make sure that youngsters have a proper space to keep enriching their minds, even in winter!
In previous restoration we couldn’t afford to change the windows, which are old and lack an isolation system. Without proper new windows, the heating system will not be of much help.
There is a small toilet in the building surroundings which needs to be also renovated, or else users of the library should go to their houses.

Projector and white screen in order to use during workshops, presentations, movie nights and other educational-leisure activities in the new creative room.

Music equipment (i.e. loudspeaker) and computers to implement IT courses and develop internet literacy among the youngest generation.

Board games, computer games, literature and textbooks in Georgian and foreign languages, DVD movies, stationary materials, maps so youngsters can use to play and spend quality time with their friends.

 
How to help us?
We know it is a challenging road, but we believe in the importance and impact that this project will bring to the local community and, specially, to the local youngsters, this is why any contribution will be highly appreciated and will with no doubt help us make a change!
If you have the possibility, we will be more than happy to meet you in the Rural Festival we will hold in Udabno on 20th of October 2018. Also, if you feel you cannot contribute economically or with tangible materials, but still share the passion for this idea and want to help us personally, contact us at goruralyouth@gmail.com, and we will provide you with all necessary information!
Thank you!

story:
Hi guys,

   we are a couple from Hungary and our goal is to make animated tales accessible for deaf and hard of hearing (HOH) children.

    And now we ask for YOUR support!

   My name is Roni. I received my sign language interpreting certificate two moths ago - and with my boyfriend, János we started to work on our project.  While I was a volunteer in a summer camp for deaf and HOH children, I realized that these children are unable to understand the programmes on kids' TV channel. That's when we decided to create a sign language-interpreted Youtube channel for them.

 

People are often unaware of the fact that sign languages are not identical to spoken languages in any countries. Full communication access is usually not provided for kids’ TV programmes. Even though there are TV channels that provide closed captioning, that is not accessible for pre-school children, who have yet to learn to read. Our target audience is the deaf and HOH kids, who are unable to fully understand and enjoy these animated tales.

 

   We have started to reach out to cartoon creation studios, and luckily they are willing to help by letting us use their animated series. We insist that our own practice must to be legally correct.

 

    Now we have 6 kids’ tales interpreted. We are planning to upload the videos to Youtube, and then we will be able to consistently record interpreted material. Slowly but surely we are building our own little studio, but at this point we have to rent a studio for the recordings and rely on our friends’ support. Unfortunately our budget has run out, so we cannot continue our project. We can’t cling on our friends forever, which is why we are asking for your help. We already have two lightboxes, and we want to buy more lighting equipment, but most importantly we need a camera that we can use for years to come. The project goal we have set will cover our technical (camera, lightboxes, movie editing software, stands, etc.) and other expenses on the long term (registering our NGO, legal administrative work and to pay for a professional who would supervise the quality of the translations).

 

Thanks for reading through our project description. We are very grateful for Your support!

 

Roni and János

story:
We wish to promote the peace process.

We are located on the border between Israel to Palestine

Making our farm an ideal location where Israeli and Palestinian children can meet,

get to know one another, While learning about nature, Fish and the environment.

We want to develop and to contribute to the regional Community out of our

Knowledge and experience which we accumulated over the past few years,

To bring people together, to enrich them and inform them about nature.

Environmental, educational and peace promoting project.

story:
something something text

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Audiences and critics loved SONDHEIM ON SONDHEIM, but due to the onset of COVID-19 our venue was forced to close its doors and we lost our final weekend. If you enjoyed the show, or if you missed us this time, please consider making a donation to help us continue to bring Broadway Theater to Brooklyn at Reasonable Prices!

BROADWAY WORLD REVIEW: Theater 2020's Sondheim on Sondheim:

"Theater 2020, Brooklyn Heights' only professional and award-winning theater company, has been my place to go for quality productions in the borough for the last few years. Being a fan of Sondheim, I've had the privilege of seeing the group's past productions of Sweeney Todd, Assassins and Into the Woods...and I can't seem to get my fill of how these dark (yet enticingly human) musicals are beautifully transposed onto a Brooklyn stage. Now, Theater2020 presents the first NYC revival of the Sondheim/ Lapine musical Sondheim on Sondheim, a revue that brings many of this musical genius' works together to create quite a show in itself. With a magnificent cast that makes harmonizing within a Sondheim score a) possible and b) seem absurdly effortless, director David Fuller brings a very noteworthy production to audiences who, whether or not they were familiar with Sondheim to begin with, will wind up loving him.

Finding a cast and crew that can captivate the audience's attention scene after scene, whether that be actors feeding off the energy of each other, or perhaps an ideal light design that so does well to follow the ebb and flow of the moods they set. Fuller and Jarosz have gathered such a beautifully talented cast - and it's no wonder, as this award-winning duo has consistently brought quality theater to the borough. And I can say with confidence that there is little chance of anyone ever being disappointed by what will come next."

BROADWAY WORLD REVIEW: Theater 2020's Into the Woods:

"Theater 2020, the only professional theater troupe in Brooklyn Heights, once again proves itself as a force to be reckoned with with this lovely production of Into the Woods; theirs is a force that brings with it the power and influence a dramatic performance ought to have. The group's past productions of other Sondheim favorites - from Sweeney Todd to Assassins (both of which I was fortunate to see) - established this group one that can bring the gift of theater by means of professionalism and extreme talent... Under the direction of David Fuller, this very talented cast perfectly combines the whimsicality of a fairy-tale world with the reality of morality and consequence... you do not want to miss the beauty that is Theater 2020's Into the Woods... Theater 2020's touch brings an added vitality to this show that not only speaks wonders of its professional quality, but also brings a phenomenal cast that actually appears happy to tell this story to the stage... Under Fuller's direction, both the subtle comedic and more dominant dramatic sides of this plot are handed over to us in perfect balance; we are very receptive to the plot's dark undertone, but this cast easily brings the story to a cohesive, satisfying whole. This cast utterly shines... this production proves that a wonderful show depends on how well an audience can admire the efforts of those who capture their attention for almost three hours; this cast are collective masters at doing just that - an added plus, they do it extremely well!"

Theater 2020, Visions for a new Millennium is guided by award winning theater artists David Fuller and Judith Jarosz who have produced and directed well over a hundred shows, Regionally, Off Broadway, and in NYC’s Indie Theatre (Off Off Broadway). They have been recognized with multiple awards and nominations including The National GLAAD awards, OOBR Awards, NYtheatre.com People of the Year, and New York Innovative Theater Awards.

We believe live performance is an important part of a healthy culture and we are committed to diversity, remaining dedicated to our multi-cultural Brooklyn audiences and artists alike. Please help us to continue this vital work by making a tax-deductible donation today and play a huge part in supporting Theater 2020’s continuing vision!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need your help to with production costs for 2021, especially our rent. We hope to rent rehearsal space at ART/NY's South Oxford Space and for production we hope to once again secure the beautiful Founders Hall Theater at St. Frances College, where we successfully produced Sondheim's INTO THE WOODS, ASSASSINS and SONDHEIM ON SONDHEIM. Rental costs continue to rise everywhere and we need your help to cover the rent for our 2021  season!

Theater 2020, Inc. is officially incorporated as a 501(c)(3) non-profit, so ANY donation you make to us a TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution for you! We are also offering all kinds of “thank you” incentives at multiple levels of giving! Check them out!

YOUR IMPACT

Thanks to you - thousands of people can continue to see low cost or FREE Theater 2020 professional level events and productions and we would be able to continue our support for emerging performers, diversity in our community and greater opportunities for women artists.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are unable to contribute even $10, there are many other ways that you can still help! Help spread the word about our campaign to others, follow Theater 2020: Facebook: Theater 2020,
Twitter: @Theater2020, Instagram: theater_2020. Or just attend an event! 

We are always looking for volunteers for various aspects of our productions. Additionally if you have any services, materials, or other in-kind donations in lieu of monetary contributions, please email us at theater2020 at gmail.com to learn more!

MORE ABOUT US

Theater 2020 is the only professional Equity theater based in Brooklyn Heights. Founded in 2010, Theater 2020’s mission is dedicated to reaching out to the community and to producing quality theater that is affordable or FREE, utilizing established professionals and fostering young artists as they emerge into the theatrical mainstream.

We are committed to diversity and inclusion, always seeking ways to cast, as our union says, “Non-traditionally,” and we are particularly aware of the gender disparity in our profession, so we have a particular emphasis on providing more opportunities for women in theater.

We produce classic and contemporary plays and musicals for a 21st Century audience and provide a nurturing atmosphere for emerging artists to work alongside seasoned professionals in a positive program of creativity.

We founded “Shakespeare at Sunset,” in 2011 at Brooklyn Bridge Park and we continue to- provide FREE performances outdoors for our community, most recently in Cadman Plaza Park. We present our FREE “Hearthside Reading Series,” stage readings of new plays and neglected classics, every few months at the Brooklyn Heights Public Library. We produce a full scale musical each winter in our neighborhood, offering tickets at prices well below Off Broadway, including deeply discounted tickets to seniors and students, plus FREE tickets to certain groups as well. Our recent musicals: the critically acclaimed and audience adored "Sondheim on Sondheim" in 2020; the multi-nominated and award winning, audience adored and critically acclaimed "The Cradle Will Rock" and "Into the Woods" in 2019; "Assassins" in 2018; the award winning “Sweeney Todd” in 201 7; and the wonderful “A Little Night Music” in 2016. We plan to continue our foray into the world of Sondheim in 2021-22, plus presenting our Theater 2020 Ten Year Anniversary Gala and "A Midsummer Night's Dream" outdoors. But we need your help to continue!

story:
Summary

During the COVID pandemic, I wrote a ballet story, The Prince of Barykova. It is a modern fairy tale about a prince who takes a trip around the world to find his wife/soulmate. It is supposed to be danced in the style of a romantic ballet and set to rock music instead of classical music. My intention is to create a new ballet tradition; The Nutcracker ballet is a part of the American Christmas tradition and I am hoping The Prince of Barykova becomes a part of the American Easter tradition. 

The ballet will be on stage in New York City in April 2022. The world premiere will be on Nightglow's YouTube channel during the Easter season in April 2022. And it will be posted on YouTube every year afterwards in celebration of Easter.

To tell you a little about myself: I am the founder of Nightglow Entertainment. It's mission: to remember forgotten stories, to tell stories no one else has told before, and for these stories to achieve immortality through performing and multi-disciplinary art forms. The first project under the Nightglow brand was The Charioteer of Rome in which I directed, produced, and self-financed. As a self-published play, it became the performing arts finalist of the 11th annual NIEA (National Indie Excellence Awards) and has already been translated into Spanish.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $25,000 US. The funds will go towards the production costs: pointe shoes, rehearsal space, recording studio sessions, costumes, set design, and performance rental space. I will pay for ads and marketing.

WE HAVE DONATION LEVELS FOR EVERY TYPE OF BUDGET! Give as much as you are able! This is a small (online) entertainment company that doesn't have the budget of other entertainment companies so every dollar COUNTS. Thanks in advance.

Patrons

Level 1: $5

Reward: A personal thank-you on all of Nightglow's social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, TikTok & YouTube)

Level 2: $10

Rewards: Level 1 PLUS A thank you during episode 9 of The Ballet Libretto, a YouTube series by Nightglow Entertainment - that will premiere on Sunday, October 31, 2021.

Level 3: $20

Rewards: Level 2 PLUS A thank you in the closing credits of the world premiere of The Prince of Barykova ballet on YouTube.

Level 4: $50

Rewards: Level 3 PLUS A thank you in the playbill of The Prince of Barykova. (A matching donation: If you invite a friend that matches your contribution dollar for dollar, you will get an autographed copy of the ballet libretto signed by the founder of Nightglow Entertainment.)

Level 5: $100

Rewards: Level 4 PLUS A thank you in the upcoming book, The Journal of a Ballet Librettist by the founder of Nightglow Ent. (A matching donation: If you invite a friend that matches your contribution dollar for dollar, you will get an autographed copy of the upcoming book signed by the founder of Nightglow Entertainment.)

The Barykova Ambassador Circle

Level 6: $300 (for the first 10 donations)

Rewards: Level 5 PLUS An invite to a Zoom meeting with the founder of Nightglow Entertainment. ALSO An invite to a Zoom class: "How to write a libretto" with the founder of Nightglow Entertainment. (If you cannot attend class, you can watch it anytime you want on YouTube via The Barykova Ambassador-only access)

Level 7: $500 (for the first 10 donations)

Rewards: Level 6 PLUS 2 tickets to see the dress rehearsal in New York City (If you cannot make it to the dress rehearsal, you can watch it on YouTube via Barykova Ambassador-only access) 

Level 8: $1,000 (for the first 10 donations)

Rewards: Level 6 PLUS 2 tickets to the performance.

Level 9: $3,000 (for the first 10 donations)

Rewards: Level 6 PLUS 4 tickets to the performance.

Level 10: $5,000 (for the first 5 donations)

Rewards: Level 6 PLUS VIP access - 4 tickets to the performance AND dine with the cast after the performance.

My intention is to create a new ballet tradition; The Nutcracker ballet is a part of the American Christmas tradition and I am hoping The Prince of Barykova becomes a part of the American Easter tradition. 
The ballet will be on stage in New York City in April 2022. The world premiere will be on Nightglow's YouTube channel during the Easter season in April 2022. And it will be posted on YouTube every year afterwards in celebration of Easter.
To tell you a little about myself: I am the founder of Nightglow Entertainment. It's mission: to remember forgotten stories, to tell stories no one else has told before, and for these stories to achieve immortality through performing and multi-disciplinary art forms. The first project under the Nightglow brand was The Charioteer of Rome in which I directed, produced, and self-financed. As a self-published play, it became the performing arts finalist of the 11th annual NIEA (National Indie Excellence Awards) and has already been translated into Spanish. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are raising $25,000 US. The funds will go towards the production costs: pointe shoes, rehearsal space, recording studio sessions, costumes, set design, and performance rental space. I will pay for ads and marketing.
WE HAVE DONATION LEVELS FOR EVERY TYPE OF BUDGET! Give as much as you are able! This is a small (online) entertainment company that doesn't have the budget of other entertainment companies so every dollar COUNTS. Thanks in advance.
Patrons
Level 1: $5
Reward: A personal thank-you on all of Nightglow's social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, TikTok & YouTube)
Level 2: $10
Rewards: Level 1 PLUS A thank you during episode 9 of The Ballet Libretto, a YouTube series by Nightglow Entertainment - that will premiere on Sunday, October 31, 2021.
Level 3: $20
Rewards: Level 2 PLUS A thank you in the closing credits of the world premiere of The Prince of Barykova ballet on YouTube.
Level 4: $50
Rewards: Level 3 PLUS A thank you in the playbill of The Prince of Barykova. (A matching donation: If you invite a friend that matches your contribution dollar for dollar, you will get an autographed copy of the ballet libretto signed by the founder of Nightglow Entertainment.)
Level 5: $100
Rewards: Level 4 PLUS A thank you in the upcoming book, The Journal of a Ballet Librettist by the founder of Nightglow Ent. (A matching donation: If you invite a friend that matches your contribution dollar for dollar, you will get an autographed copy of the upcoming book signed by the founder of Nightglow Entertainment.)
The Barykova Ambassador Circle
Level 6: $300 (for the first 10 donations)
Rewards: Level 5 PLUS An invite to a Zoom meeting with the founder of Nightglow Entertainment. ALSO An invite to a Zoom class: "How to write a libretto" with the founder of Nightglow Entertainment. (If you cannot attend class, you can watch it anytime you want on YouTube via The Barykova Ambassador-only access)
Level 7: $500 (for the first 10 donations)
Rewards: Level 6 PLUS 2 tickets to see the dress rehearsal in New York City (If you cannot make it to the dress rehearsal, you can watch it on YouTube via Barykova Ambassador-only access) 
Level 8: $1,000 (for the first 10 donations)
Rewards: Level 6 PLUS 2 tickets to the performance.
Level 9: $3,000 (for the first 10 donations)
Rewards: Level 6 PLUS 4 tickets to the performance.
Level 10: $5,000 (for the first 5 donations)
Rewards: Level 6 PLUS VIP access - 4 tickets to the performance AND dine with the cast after the performance.

story:
Tank and Tilly's ScreamPunk! Special

Tank and Tilly are ready to kick off the Halloween season with a SCREAM-TASTIC show! You bet your BROOMSTICK that this one-hour online special will leave you with chills, thrills, and loads of laughs! Tank and Tilly take on classic monster characters that will sing, dance, and make you remember how much fun "Spooky Season" can be! 

  • $10 gets you access to the show link within 48 hours of purchase. You will have access to the show link until November 21, 2021, so that you can watch at your convenience.

The pandemic has severely limited our ability to safely perform at large events. Tank & Tilly's ScreamPunk! Special will give us the ability to create original content from home for your viewing pleasure. It will also allow us to provide a COVID-safe way for fans, friends, and family to enjoy a theatrical production from the safety of their own homes this "Spooky Season".

For more information on Tank and Tilly's latest projects and events, visit www.tankandtilly.com, or "Like" our Facebook page. We look forward to entertaining you!

story:
ILLUSTRATING REAL HUMAN DREAMS

Live, with puppets. And live music.

As we hear them described by the humans who dreamt them.

A blindfolded woman stands on the wing of a red biplane on fire, smoking a cigarette.

An escaped octopus performs vaudeville to delighted onlookers,  before being corralled back into an office building.

A child’s mother is a giant windmill; he clings to the ground desperately as she tries to blow him towards a rocky cliff that leads to a wild ocean, laughing mercilessly.

All of these visions are from real dreams had by real humans; The Human Dream Project plays recordings of people intimately describing these and other dreams they’ve had as we watch puppeteers illustrate them in real time, using large, technicolor puppets and a live soundscape.

An original puppet-theater piece and ever-expanding multimedia project, The Human Dream Project exuberantly explores our shared liminal world and the intimate, inherent creative genius in every human’s dreams.

Developed as part of St. Ann’s Puppet Lab and originally scheduled to debut in 2020, The Human Dream Project will finally burst into being for an outdoor, site-specific iteration on the incredible artwork of Harvey Fite - Opus 40 in Saugerties, NY September 3 & 10th. The Human Dream Project is also slated to perform selections at St. Ann’s Warehouse as part of Puppet Lab in January, 2022 as well as online videos, future livestream/video projects, and future regional, national and international touring dates!

WHERE DID WE COME FROM?

I'm artist Admiral Grey, and throughout my career I've made music, video and theatrical works based upon dreams and because of this, I’d become a bit of an amateur dream collector and investigator of the liminal. But it wasn’t until hearing my partner’s sad, strange psychedelic dream about his time spent in Abidjan that I felt compelled to feed him a few drinks and record him casually describing it to me. I then created a soundscape and painted dozens of colorful cardboard puppets to illustrate it, and myself and performers attempted to illustrate it in real time with the puppets as the recording played. This first experiment was called Weird Dream Project and it was performed for Puppet Parlor at HERE Arts Center back in December 2019. Around the same time, The Human Dream Project was accepted into St. Ann’s Puppet Lab where an incredible amount of development and transformation happened with the project, due in no small part to the fact that Puppet Lab was indefinitely extended throughout the pandemic. So since Weird Dream Project, I have built many intricate puppets, stop motion animations, and other video-art projects based upon real people's dreams that have debuted online as well as pieces yet to be released. 

Then this spring I was asked by Opus 40 if I had a work I’d like to present there this season (Live! In-person theater! On a gorgeous outdoor sculpture!) and our new, site-specific version of The Human Dream Project for the Opus 40 space launched into being. Luckily, I received a Creative Capital Artist’s Relief Grant to help me through the worst of the pandemic, I still have the developmental support of St. Ann's Puppet Lab, and the incredible group of artists that I am lucky to have pulled together for this work has had The Freight residency to help us explore and expand our concepts, ideas, puppets, setpieces and styles to develop this show for the outdoor Opus 40 iteration and beyond. We are beside ourselves to get to present this work in such a unique and beautiful place, and we have big plans for not only our Puppet Lab showcase in January 2022, but, as I mentioned, future NYC, national and international touring shows and continuing video and livestream projects.

WHAT DO WE NEED?

We need your help to kickstart our project into creating our first full-length productions! Your support will help us towards covering the cost of transportation, materials + fabrication of puppets, costumes and props, rehearsal space, professional documentation, and fees to support our amazing team of puppeteers and artists who are using their exceptional skills, knowledge and experience to build this project into something beautiful, timeless, inclusive, and ever-evolving.

Here's a rough breakdown of minimal amounts:

$300 goes towards continuing transportation costs (van rental & gas for transporting sets, props, puppets, musical instruments, sound gear; transporting artists to and from rehearsals and shows)

$800 goes towards materials and fabrication assistance to continue designing and building the full spectrum of puppets, costumes and sets to illustrate a large roster of dreams

$300 goes towards rehearsal space

$400 goes towards documentation (professional production videos and photos)

$4000 goes towards paying our puppeteers, designers, stage manager & board op

$200 goes towards contingency (unforeseen expenses and fees)

WHAT ARE THE SUPPORT LEVELS AND WHAT DREAMY GIFTS DO WE RECEIVE?

$15 - Dream A Little Dream

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

$25 - Daydream Believer

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

 - You will be mailed an Admiral Grey-illustrated Human Dream Project printed thank you card with handwritten note

$50 - Sweet Dreams Are Made Of This

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

 - You will be mailed an Admiral Grey-illustrated Human Dream Project printed thank you card with handwritten note

- You receive a Human Dream Project original mug featuring an Admiral Grey illustration

$75 - Dreamlover

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

 - You will be mailed an Admiral Grey-illustrated Human Dream Project printed thank you card with handwritten note

- You receive a Human Dream Project original mug featuring an Admiral Grey illustration

- You receive a Human Dream Project original tote bag

$100 - Get Outta My Dreams, Get Into My Car

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

 - You will be mailed an Admiral Grey-illustrated Human Dream Project printed thank you card with handwritten note

- You receive a Human Dream Project original mug featuring an Admiral Grey illustration

- You receive a Human Dream Project original tote bag

- You receive a free download of the original live soundscape by Chad Raines

$300 Dreamweaver

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

 - You will be mailed an Admiral Grey-illustrated Human Dream Project printed thank you card with handwritten note

- You receive a Human Dream Project original mug featuring an Admiral Grey illustration

- You receive a Human Dream Project original tote bag

- You receive a free download of the original live soundtrack by Chad Raines

- You receive a dreamy Human Dream Project t shirt

$500 You Make My Dreams Come True

- Your dreamy self is thanked and named as a Supporter on digital & physical programs

 - You will be mailed an Admiral Grey-illustrated Human Dream Project printed thank you card with handwritten note

- You receive a Human Dream Project original mug featuring an Admiral Grey illustration

- You receive a Human Dream Project original tote bag

- You receive a free download of the original live soundtrack by Chad Raines

- You receive a dreamy Human Dream Project t shirt

- You receive a signed print of a Human Dream Project puppet/scene ink illustration by Admiral Grey

$1000 In Our Wildest Dreams

- You receive Producer Credit on this and all future productions of The Human Dream Project 

- You receive your choice of any/all Human Dream Project merch/gifts listed as gifts above

- You receive our gratitude and the dreamy feeling of having been a true patron of original, live, human-connecting arts. Thank you!

THE IMPACT 

Since you have read this far, it's likely you are well aware how much art and artists have suffered due to the pandemic, especially live performers. We live to create prescient, impactful works of art to share with the world to connect humans in a way that enriches the common good and helps us all understand and find beauty and meaning in life. This project seeks to connect humans from all backgrounds, binaries and nationalities through our deepest internal hopes, fears and natural creative genius. Thank you so much for helping us create this ever expanding collective work.

HOW CAN I SEE IT?

Tickets are on sale now for our Opus 40 production at https://opus40.org/human-dream-project/, and more tickets for upcoming productions will be available in the fall!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

- Please help spread the word not only about our fundraiser, but about The Human Dream Project so that we can share it with as many Humans as possible! 

- If you have a dream you would like to share that may have a possibility of becoming part of The Human Dream Project, go to the Facebook Group "Dream Bank" at https://www.facebook.com/groups/thehumandreampr... and contribute your strange, sad, weird, funny, wonderful little-big piece of natural creative genius!

A FEW THINGS WE WANT YOU TO KNOW

- The Human Dream Project is all about inclusivity and creating true and honest connection across human-made binaries and boundaries

- The Human Dream Project uses repurposed materials whenever possible and is as ecologically conscious as we can be capable of given the small level of our production

- The Human Dream Project strives for all performances to serve all bodies, whether able-bodied or challenged

- The Human Dream Project is deeply interested in finding ways to perform for groups that aren't usually exposed to/can't afford/don't have access to art and new theater/performance. Please reach out if you are part of an organization that can facilitate this or wants to work with us and hopefully we can work something out.

Thank you for being a supporter of The Human Dream Project!

story:
flausen+ International Collaboration Catalyst

Dear Friends and Colleagues

I was recently invited to bring 3 Canadian artists to the flausen+ Festival (Bielefeld, Germany) to participate in the Catalyst phase of an international collaboration with Italian, and German artists from Sept. 30, 2021-Oct. 3rd, 2021.

The flausen+ Residency is an innovation incubator that acts as a catalyst for and then develops new ideas, forms, and voices. For 4 full days, our artists will work with the Italian (Residenza I.Dra) and German (flausen+) artist teams in the f+ way of creation.  The award winning platform is supported by the flausen+ Network of 28 German companies and growing EU partners and is at the for-front of independent German innovative practices. This is a special project at the festival, and everyone is excited about the outcome.

This is an opportunity to good to pass up.

We have an amazing team gathered from across three provinces: Vanka Chaitra Salim (BC), Makram Ayache (Alberta), & Deneh'Cho Thompson (Saskatchewan).

For me it is an opportunity to share some of my experiences in international theatre with my Canadian colleagues.  For them it is an opportunity to make theatre with artists from very different backgrounds and theatrical understandings, meet new international theatre makers, and network with the German and EU organizations.  For flausen+, it is as introduction to innovative Canadian theatre artists.

As an independent artist it is impossible for me to cover the associated costs. Due to the recent nature of the invitation, we have no guarantee of receiving Canada Council funding and would not know until after the activity. Although the financial risk in international travel and collaboration is common in my personal practice, I would not ask the same of others.  

I am hoping to mitigate their risk.

Stay well and many thanks!
Jack Paterson
Bouche Theatre Collective
www.Bouchewhacked.com

 

Meet the Int. flausen+ Canada Team

MAKRAM AYACHE
Makram Ayache (he/him) is a community-engaged writer, actor, director, and producer. His playwriting explores meaningful representations of queer Arab voices. He bridges complex & interlocking political struggles to the intimate and real experiences of the people impacted by them.  Ayache is the 2020 recipient of the Playwrights’ Guide of Canada’s annual Tom Hendry Award for his play Harun. He has also been nominated for four Elizabeth Sterling Haynes Awards.  www.makramayache.com

DENEH'CHO THOMPSON
Deneh’Cho Thompson (he/him) is a director, actor and playwright and member of the Pehdzeh ki Nation. As Assistant Professor  at the University of Saskatchewan he oversees the wîcêhtowin Theatre Program, one of few Indigenous programs in a Canadian university.  Deneh’Cho’s research focuses on the development, naming, and centring of Indigenous pedagogies; new play development, in various roles, and Indigenous collaborations while centering the values of reciprocity, respect and reflexivity. Deneh’Cho is also engaged in the (re)storying of personal family archives focusing on healing, resilience, and Indigenous storywork  as a pathway towards the creation of new works of theatre.

VANKA CHAITRA SALIM
Vanka Chaitra Salim (she/her) is a Muslim Indonesian-Canadian Set, Lighting and  Projection designer, theatre technician and scenic painter based in the Unceded xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh-ulh Temíx̱w (Squamish), and səl̓ilwətaɁɬ təməxʷ (Tsleil-Waututh) territories, colonially known as Vancouver, BC. She enjoys experimenting with different mediums of storytelling that revolve around the interaction and interplay of art, culture and technology. Apart from her involvement in the theatre community,  Vanka also works as an acrylic paint-maker at Kroma Artist's Acrylics and is part of Srikandi Indonesia Dance Group. She also loves gaming, game art & design, dance, videography, illustration and learning XR technologies, and has recently been experimenting with immersive experiences. She is grateful and beyond excited to have the opportunity to learn, collaborate and experiment with the rest of the team at Flausen+ Festival.  www.vankasalim.com

Canada Creative Producer

JACK PATERSON
Jack (he/him) is a Vancouver launched devisor, director, dramaturg, translator, and theatre maker. Projects have ranged from contemporary devising, cross-cultural, multi-disciplinary and multi-lingual events to main stage and classical theatre in contemporary form across Canada, UK, Europe and Indonesia.  He is the co-founder of Bouche Theatre Collective (Vancouver) and Global Hive Labs., a network of international independent artists working together in shared practice. www.JackPatersonTheatre.com

BOUCHE THEATRE COLLECTIVE (Canada)
Founded in Vancouver Canada in 2012, Bouche bridges local, national, and international artists and audiences separated by language, distance, and culture.  With a specific focus on the cross pollination between Canadian francophone and anglophone artists and the international community, Bouche reaches out through translation, multi-lingual work, and devised creation. BTC is a member of the Presentation House Theatre Creative Hub Co-operative.  www.bouchewhacked.com

International Creation Partners

RESIDENZA I.DRA (Italy)

www.residenzaidra.it

Based in Brescia (Italy), Residenza IDra is a  multidisciplinary independent development and producing centre, Our desire to be adequate to our times, in search of new forms of representation through integration and collaboration.  In addition to development residencies, IDra produces The Wonderland Festival (Mibact and the Lombardy Region), Città Dolci Touring Circuit, NdN (New dramaturgy Network), CURA Project and AL Petroni Award. IDRA actively participates in various networks including CRESCO, ETRE and IETM.

FLAUSEN+ & FLAUSEN+ FESTIVAL (Germany)

www.flausen.plus

flausen+  is unique innovation incubator platform for generating new forms, new approaches and new ideas.  For the last decade, the "flausen+" model has been driving creative scenic research by providing paid residencies for process based new explorations free of the pressure of production.  To date flausen+ has facilitated over 48 ensembles and 160 artists in their research. flausen + explicitly promotes bold approaches and highly current socio-political topics.

flausen + residency ensembles have gone on to receive high acclaim with their work presented at leading EU companies such as GHent (Brussels) and festivals. According to pulk fiktion, recipient of prestigious George Tabori Award for their work placing children and parents on an equal footing, "we would never have dared to tackle such a theme and aesthetic form without flausen."

Supported by the flausen+ network of 29 theatres across Germany, flausen+ awards 9 residencies per year, in 5 German states hosted by 8 theaters.  In addition to producing, hosting and artistic support of the residencies, flausen+ Network members provide administrative support.  

Ensemble projects developed through the flausen+ Residencies are further supported by the network with additional research periods, 2 co-productions with flausen+ network theatres per year, the network touring model (NATIONALE PERFORMANCE NETZ) and are showcased at The flausen+ Festival (Bielefeld) and the flausen+ bundeskongress (Koln).

Presenting f+ projects, the biennial f+ Festival has become a gathering point for independent, small, and mid-sized companies from across the EU.  Artists, company leaderships, and cultural representatives meet, develop new artistic and admin. relationships, and exchange knowledge through a series of networking activities, workshops, panels, and events.

How You Can Support:

We have broken down the costs for each Canadian artist's participation below.   Sponsor a Flight, Sustenance, PCR Test or Insurance or support how you wish. Every little bit helps.

$1500 - Support an artist’s travel (as per Canada Council Travel Calculator)
$750 - Support an artist’s Subsistence Per Diem for total project (5d)
$200 - Support an artist’s Covid 19 PCR Test (required for return to Canada) 
$150 - Support an artist’s daily Subsistence Per Diem (1d)
$100 - Travel and Health Insurance (including Covid19 coverage)

Or

Support as you see fit - Every little bit helps!

In return, we will thank you live at the flausen+ Festival, and will acknowledge your support with a thank you, logo and website link in any online materials such as webpage and newsletters.  

Land Acknowledgement

Jack’s activities take place on and are launched from the unceded traditional territories of the Coast Salish People: the Musqueam, Squamish and Tsleil-Waututh First Nations. We recognize and honour the recommendations from the Truth and Reconciliation commission and acknowledge the importance of Indigenous sovereignty on this unceded territory.

*A territorial or land acknowledgement is an act of reconciliation that involves making a statement recognizing the traditional territory of the Indigenous people who called the land home before the arrival of settlers, and in many cases still do call it home. For more information on the Truth and Reconciliation Commission of Canada click here. www.nctr.ca
story_txt: flausen+ International Collaboration CatalystDear Friends and ColleaguesI was recently invited to bring 3 Canadian artists to the flausen+ Festival (Bielefeld, Germany) to participate in the Catalyst phase of an international collaboration with Italian, and German artists from Sept. 30, 2021-Oct. 3rd, 2021.The flausen+ Residency is an innovation incubator that acts as a catalyst for and then develops new ideas, forms, and voices. For 4 full days, our artists will work with the Italian (Residenza I.Dra) and German (flausen+) artist teams in the f+ way of creation.  The award winning platform is supported by the flausen+ Network of 28 German companies and growing EU partners and is at the for-front of independent German innovative practices. This is a special project at the festival, and everyone is excited about the outcome.This is an opportunity to good to pass up.We have an amazing team gathered from across three provinces: Vanka Chaitra Salim (BC), Makram Ayache (Alberta), & Deneh'Cho Thompson (Saskatchewan).For me it is an opportunity to share some of my experiences in international theatre with my Canadian colleagues.  For them it is an opportunity to make theatre with artists from very different backgrounds and theatrical understandings, meet new international theatre makers, and network with the German and EU organizations.  For flausen+, it is as introduction to innovative Canadian theatre artists.As an independent artist it is impossible for me to cover the associated costs. Due to the recent nature of the invitation, we have no guarantee of receiving Canada Council funding and would not know until after the activity. Although the financial risk in international travel and collaboration is common in my personal practice, I would not ask the same of others.  I am hoping to mitigate their risk.Stay well and many thanks!Jack PatersonBouche Theatre Collectivewww.Bouchewhacked.com Meet the Int. flausen+ Canada TeamMAKRAM AYACHEMakram Ayache (he/him) is a community-engaged writer, actor, director, and producer. His playwriting explores meaningful representations of queer Arab voices. He bridges complex & interlocking political struggles to the intimate and real experiences of the people impacted by them.  Ayache is the 2020 recipient of the Playwrights’ Guide of Canada’s annual Tom Hendry Award for his play Harun. He has also been nominated for four Elizabeth Sterling Haynes Awards.  www.makramayache.comDENEH'CHO THOMPSONDeneh’Cho Thompson (he/him) is a director, actor and playwright and member of the Pehdzeh ki Nation. As Assistant Professor  at the University of Saskatchewan he oversees the wîcêhtowin Theatre Program, one of few Indigenous programs in a Canadian university.  Deneh’Cho’s research focuses on the development, naming, and centring of Indigenous pedagogies; new play development, in various roles, and Indigenous collaborations while centering the values of reciprocity, respect and reflexivity. Deneh’Cho is also engaged in the (re)storying of personal family archives focusing on healing, resilience, and Indigenous storywork  as a pathway towards the creation of new works of theatre.VANKA CHAITRA SALIMVanka Chaitra Salim (she/her) is a Muslim Indonesian-Canadian Set, Lighting and  Projection designer, theatre technician and scenic painter based in the Unceded xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh-ulh Temíx̱w (Squamish), and səl̓ilwətaɁɬ təməxʷ (Tsleil-Waututh) territories, colonially known as Vancouver, BC. She enjoys experimenting with different mediums of storytelling that revolve around the interaction and interplay of art, culture and technology. Apart from her involvement in the theatre community,  Vanka also works as an acrylic paint-maker at Kroma Artist's Acrylics and is part of Srikandi Indonesia Dance Group. She also loves gaming, game art & design, dance, videography, illustration and learning XR technologies, and has recently been experimenting with immersive experiences. She is grateful and beyond excited to have the opportunity to learn, collaborate and experiment with the rest of the team at Flausen+ Festival.  www.vankasalim.comCanada Creative ProducerJACK PATERSONJack (he/him) is a Vancouver launched devisor, director, dramaturg, translator, and theatre maker. Projects have ranged from contemporary devising, cross-cultural, multi-disciplinary and multi-lingual events to main stage and classical theatre in contemporary form across Canada, UK, Europe and Indonesia.  He is the co-founder of Bouche Theatre Collective (Vancouver) and Global Hive Labs., a network of international independent artists working together in shared practice. www.JackPatersonTheatre.comBOUCHE THEATRE COLLECTIVE (Canada)Founded in Vancouver Canada in 2012, Bouche bridges local, national, and international artists and audiences separated by language, distance, and culture.  With a specific focus on the cross pollination between Canadian francophone and anglophone artists and the international community, Bouche reaches out through translation, multi-lingual work, and devised creation. BTC is a member of the Presentation House Theatre Creative Hub Co-operative.  www.bouchewhacked.comInternational Creation PartnersRESIDENZA I.DRA (Italy)www.residenzaidra.itBased in Brescia (Italy), Residenza IDra is a  multidisciplinary independent development and producing centre, Our desire to be adequate to our times, in search of new forms of representation through integration and collaboration.  In addition to development residencies, IDra produces The Wonderland Festival (Mibact and the Lombardy Region), Città Dolci Touring Circuit, NdN (New dramaturgy Network), CURA Project and AL Petroni Award. IDRA actively participates in various networks including CRESCO, ETRE and IETM.FLAUSEN+ & FLAUSEN+ FESTIVAL (Germany)www.flausen.plusflausen+  is unique innovation incubator platform for generating new forms, new approaches and new ideas.  For the last decade, the "flausen+" model has been driving creative scenic research by providing paid residencies for process based new explorations free of the pressure of production.  To date flausen+ has facilitated over 48 ensembles and 160 artists in their research. flausen + explicitly promotes bold approaches and highly current socio-political topics.flausen + residency ensembles have gone on to receive high acclaim with their work presented at leading EU companies such as GHent (Brussels) and festivals. According to pulk fiktion, recipient of prestigious George Tabori Award for their work placing children and parents on an equal footing, "we would never have dared to tackle such a theme and aesthetic form without flausen."Supported by the flausen+ network of 29 theatres across Germany, flausen+ awards 9 residencies per year, in 5 German states hosted by 8 theaters.  In addition to producing, hosting and artistic support of the residencies, flausen+ Network members provide administrative support.  Ensemble projects developed through the flausen+ Residencies are further supported by the network with additional research periods, 2 co-productions with flausen+ network theatres per year, the network touring model (NATIONALE PERFORMANCE NETZ) and are showcased at The flausen+ Festival (Bielefeld) and the flausen+ bundeskongress (Koln).Presenting f+ projects, the biennial f+ Festival has become a gathering point for independent, small, and mid-sized companies from across the EU.  Artists, company leaderships, and cultural representatives meet, develop new artistic and admin. relationships, and exchange knowledge through a series of networking activities, workshops, panels, and events.How You Can Support:We have broken down the costs for each Canadian artist's participation below.   Sponsor a Flight, Sustenance, PCR Test or Insurance or support how you wish. Every little bit helps.$1500 - Support an artist’s travel (as per Canada Council Travel Calculator)$750 - Support an artist’s Subsistence Per Diem for total project (5d)$200 - Support an artist’s Covid 19 PCR Test (required for return to Canada) $150 - Support an artist’s daily Subsistence Per Diem (1d)$100 - Travel and Health Insurance (including Covid19 coverage)OrSupport as you see fit - Every little bit helps!In return, we will thank you live at the flausen+ Festival, and will acknowledge your support with a thank you, logo and website link in any online materials such as webpage and newsletters.  Land AcknowledgementJack’s activities take place on and are launched from the unceded traditional territories of the Coast Salish People: the Musqueam, Squamish and Tsleil-Waututh First Nations. We recognize and honour the recommendations from the Truth and Reconciliation commission and acknowledge the importance of Indigenous sovereignty on this unceded territory.*A territorial or land acknowledgement is an act of reconciliation that involves making a statement recognizing the traditional territory of the Indigenous people who called the land home before the arrival of settlers, and in many cases still do call it home. For more information on the Truth and Reconciliation Commission of Canada click here. www.nctr.ca

story:
Overview

A phantasmagoria about otherness, space, time-travel, religion, bodies, and bad photography.

Your donations will help bring this workshop production of Joshua Young’s mind-bending play to life at The Brick, Williamsburg's primary incubator of innovative theater and performing arts. 

Nov 11-13 @ 8pm

Tickets available HERE 

About the Show

Holy ghost people is a bad name for them. but we can’t shuck it away. it clings. everyone still uses it. the holy ghost people are not ghosts. they have real hair. god loves them most, so they say. all of a sudden they were standing in our lawns, in our traffic, in our malls, & they were wearing white cloth & they were speaking & speaking & speaking. 

Did you see them conjure Sylvia?

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––

I first picked up Joshua Young's play The Holy Ghost People in 2018. I never finished it, but I couldn't stop thinking about it. I did this again and again for 2 years.

On December 30th, 2020 I gathered some of my favorite collaborators together online and we read the script for the first time. We talked about it for hours. 

Now, we're presenting excerpts from The Holy Ghost People onstage at The Brick this November. 

 

Cast

The Holy Ghost People: Kristin Sgarro, Anna Stacy, & Rachel Weekley

The Speakers: RJ Christian & Jacob Cowan

 

Creative Team

Writer: Joshua Young

Director: Robert Malbrough

Lighting Designer: Mike Schulz

Costume Designer: LA Clevenson

Producer: Zeynep Akça

 

About the author

Joshua Young is a playwright, designer, and multimedia artist living in Everett, Washington. He is the author of six collections, most recently, Psalms of the Wreckage (Plays Inverse, Press 2017), and the forthcoming novella, Little Galaxies (Variant, 2021). His films have been an official selection at Seattle International Film Festival, Athens International Film Festival, and Montreal International Black Film Festival, among others, and his hybrid documentary, A Carnage in the Lovetrees, is currently in post-production.

 

What We Need 

We need to raise a total of $2,500 to fund this project.

Here's where your money is going: 

                 Actors & Designers: $1,800

                 Rehearsal Space: $200

                 Production Costs: $275

                 Marketing Costs: $100

                 IndieGoGo Fees: $125

This production would not be possible without your generosity.

 

What You Get

Not only will your donation bring this show to life, we have some great donation perks as well!

Perks Include

Personalized thanks

Meaningful nods

Tasty beverages

Godhood

And more!

Check out the full list of perks to the right!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you aren't able to donate, please share our campaign and help us get the word out!

  • One of the best ways to get attention is by word of mouth!
