story:
Our Work

Arm-of-the-Sea Theater is a high-quality, creative, community-based mask and puppet theater group that tours throughout the Hudson Valley, New York State, and beyond. We are integrating our award-winning artistic and environmental advocacy achievements to bring the Tidewater Center to our Hudson River Valley community. This new venue will serve a dual-purpose as a cultural gathering space and the future home for our organization.

Our mission is to deliver wonder, joy, and insight to inspire the next generation of environmental stewards. We believe that having fun, caring about social issues, and making good art is vitally important to the community.  Our touring company, with five performers and a one-man-band, typically presents 50 to 75 performances each year, reaching over 15,000 guests. We also conduct theater residency programs at schools and camps.

We’ve been touring since 1982 and are ready to settle down! We found a fantastic spot on Esopus Creek in Saugerties, about 100 miles north of New York City, but there’s a catch. It’s on the site of the 19th century Sheffield paper mill, so we have A LOT to clean up. There are ruins and sluiceways, a deteriorated bulkhead, and some coal ash contamination.  We aren’t just building a new center to celebrate art, science and history- we are also cleaning up a brownfield and revitalizing the shoreline!

Eventually, the Tidewater Center will have a theater/events building lined by 350 feet of new public waterfront. There will be an environmental science center, art studio, waterworks playground, and a space to offer programming for children and seniors. We’ll also be booking other magnificent performers!

            Every long journey starts with a few steps. This spring, we will clean up the site, build a parking lot, and construct an outdoor performance space. This will let us open for summer to offer live entertainment from Arm-of-the-Sea Theater and other performers. Imagine sitting on a hillside on a summer night and watching a live show with the creek sparkling in the background!

Arm-of-the-Sea Theater brings people together. We have an amazing opportunity to move into our new space, the Tidewater Center, and transform it into a hub of creativity to share with residents and visitors alike. We can’t do it without your support.

Help us make Arm-of-the-Sea’s vision a reality. When you contribute to our efforts, you will receive exclusive donation rewards!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are fundraising for $50,000.  The entire cost to clean up and open this summer is $100,000.  We have already raised half of this - you can help us with the rest!
  • The money will be used for basics like adding fill to clean up the site, building a retaining wall, and adding a parking lot, as well as for essential theater amenities like utilities, signage, and restrooms.
  • Get perks when you donate, including free tickets to our grand opening, ice cream and tee shirts, a behind-the-scenes look at our studios and even a tour of Esopus Creek in our founder’s fishing skiff!
  • Every time we hit a new fundraising milestone, we will have a pop-up event, like a bring-your-own virtual ice cream party, or a puppet-hosted virtual ribbon-cutting to ceremonialize site work progress.

The Impact

Here's how the new Arm-of-the-Sea Tidewater Center will make an impact:

  • .For 38 years we have toured our shows, fostering a sense of curiosity and connection throughout the Hudson Valley and beyond.  With a space of our own, we look forward to investing in the people and telling the stories of our local community.
  • With 350 feet of new public waterfront, the Tidewater Center will provide access to fishing, strolling and general enjoyment on the shore of Esopus Creek.  Not to mention the Covid-safe outdoor performance space overlooking the creek!
  • Our programs will offer opportunities for people of all ages to participate! From Arts & Science camps to the theater internship program and resident company to giant puppet pageants, there will be many possibilities to get out, have fun and be creative. 
  • We will collaborate with other local arts organizations, such as Shout Out Saugerties, to bring even more live theater and other events to the Tidewater Center.
  • The arts are important! If you don't believe us go talk to teachers, social workers, parents, and more.  They know that having a creative passion can make or break the lives of kids and adults alike. Saugerties and the Hudson Valley will benefit tremendously from having this outlet.

Risks & Challenges

Someone once said, "It's always impossible until it's done."  We have come a long way - and now have an approved Master Plan, construction drawings, 75 feet of reconstructed bulkhead- but it’s important that we finish the sitework so we can open the Tidewater Center this summer.

  • Risk 1: Not raising enough money. The good news is that we are halfway there. We are addressing this risk by turning over every stone to search for funds.  We are presenting our plans to many different people, businesses and foundations, so that when we get close to reaching our funding goal, we can ask again for a little bit more of their support.
  • Risk 2: Covid-19 delays. The good news is that this will be an outdoor performance space. The audience will be safely distanced, and our puppeteers will perform safely. (It is MASKED theater, after all!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially,, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends and co-workers!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Please share this campaign with your friends and co-workers!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Project

Would you rather be blithely ignorant or engaged and disillusioned?  Can you really be friends with someone with whom you fundamentally disagree? What do we owe our friends?

An Intervention by Mike Bartlett is a fast-paced and funny two-hander that examines the limits of friendship and responsibility. It asks us to consider how and when to intervene in both personal and political matters.

During the past year and a half of relative isolation, I found myself craving connection in theatre and life. Bartlett’s script is nuanced and complex, never trite or moralizing. I am eager for audiences to wrestle with the questions it poses. As we begin to emerge from the pandemic, I’m thrilled to bring this play—a battle cry for connection against all odds—to life in an intimate production showcasing the work of our artists at the Shea Theater in Turner’s Falls.   --Gabby, the director.

Our team is hard at work rehearsing and getting this play ready for an August production, but we need your help!

Praise for Mike Bartlett

"He attacks apathy. No one gets out of his plays unscathed, and that includes himself.” --Playwright Duncan Macmillan in The Guardian

"Bartlett’s work wields big ideas fearlessly." --The Financial Times

“[Mike Bartlett] has gained a reputation for finding dramatic forms to address our changing reality….Bartlett’s plays are political, but they are not manifestos.” --Prospect Magazine

 

Who We Are

MAD House

We're a group of current and former Smith College students passionate about making theatre that is adventurous in style and subject matter.

Gabby Farrah, Director and Co-Producer, MAD House

June Lienhard, Actor and Co-Producer, MAD House

Wren Gilbert, Actor

Michelle Erard, Movement Director

Sasha Belcher, Lighting Designer

Eva Shannon-Dabek, Stage Manager

 

Eggtooth Productions

By producing works in all manner of spaces, amplifying marginalized voices in our community, mentoring new artists, and creating in response to the Valley landscape, we use place-making, social justice, and environmental stewardship as starting points for new work.

Your Donation

We're thrilled to be bringing this play to audiences, live and in person, but we need your help. The $3500 we raise will go toward compensating our artists, renting our space, performance rights, and funding set, sound, costumes, props, and lights. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to donate, we'd appreciate your support in spreading the word about our campaign (feel free to share our Indiegogo page!) and our play!

story:
WE WROTE A MUSICAL

TLDR; here's what you need to know:

  • We wrote a musical
  • We put on an early workshop of it in Chicago
  • The show got accepted by a panel of judges (they only accept 10 shows a year!) to appear at the Chicago Musical Theatre Festival in February 2020
  • Putting on a show is expensive though


We're extremely grateful for any support you can lend us to pay our cast, crew, artists, venues, and other festival costs.

Deepak and I started making music together in high school. I'm not going to say there was an instant spark because there wasn't but there was potential there, and a whole lot of trust in each other. In college we kept making music, (directing competing acapella groups, which both placed at ICCAs at a national level). After college, I was a little directionless at my new-grad job and one day Deepak messaged me to ask if I wanted to write a musical with him. Fast-forward two years to May of 2019, when we found ourselves putting on an early workshop of Baked! The Musical in Chicago, selling out the whole theatre, setting up more folding chairs, and then selling out those seats as well!

The week after that workshop, the show was invited by a panel of judges to appear at Chicago Musical Theatre Festival in February 2020. Since then, we've been rewriting character arcs, crafting new songs, and preparing for the onslaught of work that goes into putting on a musical.

Come see Baked! The Musical at The Edge Theatre "Off Broadway" ​(1133 W Catalpa Ave, Chicago, IL 60640) at any of the following shows:

  • February 3rd -- Preview all CMTF musicals for free at 8 pm
  • February 6th at 8 pm
  • February 9th at 3 pm
  • February 12th at 8 pm
  • February 15th at 3 pm
  • February 18th at 8 pm
  • February 21st at 7 pm
     

TELL ME MORE ABOUT THE SHOW

"Baked! The Musical" is a story about family, growing up, and what it means to fail. It will feature an all Asian cast.

Other high school coming of age musicals (e.g. Be More Chill, Dear Evan Hansen, Heathers) never felt quite honest to us. Our high school experiences weren’t punctuated with bullying and sex, obsession with popularity, and loneliness. Baked! The Musical tells a story that rings more true – one where people are mostly nice, parents actually want what’s best for you, and pain comes from constructs within our own minds as much as it does our external circumstances.

That's the story we want to tell. It's our story and, we think, a lot of yours.

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR

  • $1400 festival fees
    - This covers all of the shared resources between the various shows (performance space, general marketing, front-of-house services, lighting and sound equipment, technicians, keyboard, etc)
  • $600 on rehearsal spaces
    - Rehearsal spaces cost between $10-20 an hour, which can add up after a few days of 4 hour rehearsals
  • $5000 to pay our personnel
    - We have 6 principal actors, 3 ensemble members, a director, music director, and stage manager to pay!
  • $2000 on casting
    - Casting an all-Asian show is hard. This covers the cost of audition spaces, equipment rentals, and potentially working with casting directors and agencies.
  • $500 on marketing and graphics
    - While CMTF does some advertising, it's up to individual shows to market themselves. This money covers the cost of our graphic designer and the creation of other marketing materials and campaigns
  • $300 on design
    - We're trying to keep the production as minimal as possible for the festival, but a little set and prop work can really help bring the show to life
  • $200 on videography
    - We're actually not from Chicago which means a lot of our friends won't be able to see this show live!


This is a rough budget but should be essentially correct. Most of the money is going to artists. All of the money is going to people who are supporting the arts in some way!

HOW ELSE CAN I HELP

Not everyone can support our show with a donation and we understand that! You can help us out in other ways like coming to see us in FEBRUARY of 2020, buying some merchandise, or sharing this campaign on social media!
story_txt:
WE WROTE A MUSICAL
TLDR; here's what you need to know:

We wrote a musical
We put on an early workshop of it in Chicago
The show got accepted by a panel of judges (they only accept 10 shows a year!) to appear at the Chicago Musical Theatre Festival in February 2020
Putting on a show is expensive though

We're extremely grateful for any support you can lend us to pay our cast, crew, artists, venues, and other festival costs.
Deepak and I started making music together in high school. I'm not going to say there was an instant spark because there wasn't but there was potential there, and a whole lot of trust in each other. In college we kept making music, (directing competing acapella groups, which both placed at ICCAs at a national level). After college, I was a little directionless at my new-grad job and one day Deepak messaged me to ask if I wanted to write a musical with him. Fast-forward two years to May of 2019, when we found ourselves putting on an early workshop of Baked! The Musical in Chicago, selling out the whole theatre, setting up more folding chairs, and then selling out those seats as well!
The week after that workshop, the show was invited by a panel of judges to appear at Chicago Musical Theatre Festival in February 2020. Since then, we've been rewriting character arcs, crafting new songs, and preparing for the onslaught of work that goes into putting on a musical.
Come see Baked! The Musical at The Edge Theatre "Off Broadway" ​(1133 W Catalpa Ave, Chicago, IL 60640) at any of the following shows:

February 3rd -- Preview all CMTF musicals for free at 8 pm
February 6th at 8 pm
February 9th at 3 pm
February 12th at 8 pm
February 15th at 3 pm
February 18th at 8 pm
February 21st at 7 pm 


TELL ME MORE ABOUT THE SHOW
"Baked! The Musical" is a story about family, growing up, and what it means to fail. It will feature an all Asian cast.

Other high school coming of age musicals (e.g. Be More Chill, Dear Evan Hansen, Heathers) never felt quite honest to us. Our high school experiences weren’t punctuated with bullying and sex, obsession with popularity, and loneliness. Baked! The Musical tells a story that rings more true – one where people are mostly nice, parents actually want what’s best for you, and pain comes from constructs within our own minds as much as it does our external circumstances.
That's the story we want to tell. It's our story and, we think, a lot of yours.


WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR

$1400 festival fees- This covers all of the shared resources between the various shows (performance space, general marketing, front-of-house services, lighting and sound equipment, technicians, keyboard, etc)
$600 on rehearsal spaces- Rehearsal spaces cost between $10-20 an hour, which can add up after a few days of 4 hour rehearsals
$5000 to pay our personnel- We have 6 principal actors, 3 ensemble members, a director, music director, and stage manager to pay!
$2000 on casting- Casting an all-Asian show is hard. This covers the cost of audition spaces, equipment rentals, and potentially working with casting directors and agencies.
$500 on marketing and graphics- While CMTF does some advertising, it's up to individual shows to market themselves. This money covers the cost of our graphic designer and the creation of other marketing materials and campaigns
$300 on design- We're trying to keep the production as minimal as possible for the festival, but a little set and prop work can really help bring the show to life
$200 on videography- We're actually not from Chicago which means a lot of our friends won't be able to see this show live!

This is a rough budget but should be essentially correct. Most of the money is going to artists. All of the money is going to people who are supporting the arts in some way!
HOW ELSE CAN I HELPNot everyone can support our show with a donation and we understand that! You can help us out in other ways like coming to see us in FEBRUARY of 2020, buying some merchandise, or sharing this campaign on social media!

story:
The Nest 

A pole dance, movement and bodyworks studio. Coming soon to Brooklyn. But first...

 

Who Am I?

Hey guys, I'm Sammy. First off BIG thank you for considering donating to this project. I hold it close to my heart. For those of you who don't know I've overcome various ailments- including symptoms of a cancer diagnosis- through alternative forms of medicine. Those forms included: 

pole dance

meditation 

acupuncture 

When Western medicine could no longer help me, all three of these practices (to my surprise at the time) healed my mind and, in turn, my body. I want to bring these practices - and the opportunity to self-heal-  to communities that are not currently being served in Brooklyn. That is why this studio space is such a special project for me. Your contribution will help make this happen.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need: My goal is to raise $25,000 to bring this studio to fruition. 

What you get: We will open our doors in Spring of 2020. We will offer pole dance, dance foundations, and (full body!) bootcamp classes. We will also offer acupuncture and bodywork treatments for our students to ensure that they are able to keep doing what they love.

 

The Impact

My goal for all of my work, and for this studio, is to give people the opportunity to heal themselves. Healing one's spirit, mind and body is possible for everyone, but due to the nature of our lives is often easier said than done. This space is being designed to make it easier for us. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate at this time? I understand, and thank you for taking the time to read this. Another way you can help is by sharing this fundraiser with your friends and family. And when we open our doors this Spring, come play!! 

Sincerely, 

Sammy

story:
About the Show

A fierce social critic and the first woman awarded the Pulitzer Prize (The Age of Innocence, 1920) Edith Wharton's chilling short stories are the beating heart of this devised play probing the confinement of social norms and the price the living pay for ignoring the past.

After a two-year hiatus, I returned to the rehearsal studio at the end of summer along with an incredible ensemble of actors and designers. Together, we are having a wonderful time using devising techniques to make this original performance. I'm excited to share the work we are creating, and I hope you will join us at Triskelion Arts this October! 

Performances are:

Friday, October 22, 7:30 PM
Saturday, October 23, 2:00 PM*
Saturday, October 23, 7:30 PM
Sunday, October 24, 2:00 PM

Tickets can be purchased directly at Eventbrite.

* Following 2:00 PM performance on Saturday, October 23, director Kevin Ray will host a free, interactive talk-back with audience members.

How Your Contribution Helps

Your support helps keep ticket prices affordable so everyone can access live theater in Brooklyn. By contributing to this fundraiser, your money goes directly to covering the cost of:

  • Artist fees for Actors and Designers;
  • Renting, purchasing and constructing costumes, set pieces,  and props;
  • Rental of our performance space at Triskelion Arts;
  • Rental of rehearsal spaces.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the fundraiser at this time, you can still support the project by:

  • Buy a ticket to the performance at Eventbrite .
  • Like and Share the content on the project's Facebook and Instagram.
  • Sign up for the Newsletter on the Blog.

story:
Short Summary

Radial Theater Project will present Locally Grown, a festival of original work by local performing artists at New City Theater, January 30-February 28, 2015.

Why We're Creating the Festival

Radial Theater Project's mission is to support the creation of original work by local theater artists. Seattle is home to many adventurous performing artists who tour their work nationally and internationally. Locally Grown will bring many of them together under a single roof, where local audiences can see their favorites and be introduced to new artists in an intimate setting.

We're showing off some of Seattle's best performers. Many of them work mostly out of town, on the fringe festival circuit or through presenters in other cities. At this festival, Seattle audiences have a chance to see the work here, before it hits the road. And all of the tickets are affordable.

What We Need & What You Get

The festival's business model is artist-friendly. Artists pay a fixed amount to cover space rent, and receive 100% of the rest of their box office receipts. We need your financial support to cover staffing and marketing costs.

We'll honor you with an acknowledgment in the theater lobby,  and depending on your donation level, you can receive perks ranging from festival souvenirs to tickets to see the shows.

The Impact

Locally Grown is unique in its approach: We've identified and invited theater artists with a proven track record, and we've said: "Create Something".  All of these artists regularly create inspiring, entertaining shows, and they know how to produce and market the work with the support of a presenting organization (such as a fringe festival). But presenting the work on their own, in their own home town, is expensive and financially risky, and so they only do it infrequently. Locally Grown offers artists that essential support. And Seattle audiences get to see the work first, before it starts to travel the world. We think it's a great deal for everyone.

Risks & Challenges

Radial Theater Project has a lot of experience in creating new work, having commissioned and produced 5 world premieres by local playwrights since the company's inception. This festival is the next step in our evolution. We need your support to ensure that the festival breaks even and we can present it again in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help in getting the word out, about the festival and about this fundraising campaign. Share these links with your friends!

  • Our web site is: 
    http://radialtheater.org
  • A complete performance schedule is at: 
    http://radialtheater.org/performance-schedule
  • Our Facebook page is at:
     https://www.facebook.com/RadialTheater

And you can buy advance tickets for festival performances at:
  http://www.brownpapertickets.com/profile/816889

story:
"REINVENTION OF DISCO"

starring Grammy-nominated Recording Artist, American Idol/The Voice Finalist & Broadway Star FRENCHIE DAVIS


For the very first time, the phenomenal music of the Queen Of Disco  is celebrated in a brand new LIVE multimedia stage spectacle--a fitting tribute to one of the world's best-selling artists of all time, with over 130 millions records sold to date.

Featuring Grammy-winning and Billboard number 1 hits like Bad Girls, Hot Stuff, She Works Hard For The Money, McArthur Park, I Feel Love and Last Dance to name a few.

This is beautiful, melodic, uplifting and memorable dance music that defined the 70s, the soundtrack to an era--ReMIXED, ReCREATED, ReIMAGINED, ReINVENTED!

Powerhouse VOCAL DIVAS, sensational DANCERS, with spectacular VIDEO IMAGERY as backdrop, REINVENTION OF DISCO is guaranteed to entertain and get everybody to sing along and get up on their feet.

Disco Is Not Dead.  

Ultimate powerhouse vocal diva FRENCHIE DAVIS, Grammy-nominated recording artist, Broadway star and finalist of American Idol and The Voice stars in REINVENTION OF DISCO live on April 24, 2015, Friday, 8pm at the Edgewater Casino (Downtown Vancouver, BC)

More on Frenchie Davis here:  https://vimeo.com/117615756

More on the show here:

www.reinventionofdisco.com


Contribute and Help 

As this is an INDEPENDENTLY-PRODUCED show, your contribution will help cover some expenses for staging the show and to support the struggling live theatre arts in Vancouver.

A portion of the proceeds will be allocated as well to a local charitable organization.

You can donate ANY AMOUNT or check out the PERKS for specific donation amounts and receive show souvenir photos, premium show tickets and other perks when you donate.


Support Vancouver talent in a world-class show!

Your contribution will come a long way in supporting local productions and talents.   

Cast includes: 

Catherine Pedersen - Vancouver, BC - dancer

Molly Wilson - Vancouver, BC - singer

Joel Sturrock - Vancouver, BC - dancer

Avril Robinson - Vancouver, BC - singer

Tara Wilson - Vancouver, BC - dancer

Leandro Mendez - Vancouver, BC - dancer

Kathryn Schellenberg - Vancouver, BC - dancer

Tota Mendez - Burnaby, BC - singer

Allison Riley - Vancouver, BC - singer


Help us get the word out!


Feel free to forward on this campaign to all your friends! 

A fun night of fantastic music, incredible vocals and spectacular dancers-GUARANTEED!

REINVENTION OF DISCO

April 24, 2015 | Friday | 8pm | Edgewater Casino (Downtown Vancouver, BC)

story:
WHO WE ARE

Berlin International Youth Theatre (BIYT) is a  MAGICAL MIXTURE  of young people ages 13-19, from different countries, cultures, ages, and schools coming together to develop acting skills,  BUILD SELF ESTEEM , work together as in ensemble, and  MAKE NEW FRIENDS , All of this hard work is channeled into the creation of a yearly  LIVE PERFORMANCE  in a professional theater in the heart of Berlin.

What makes it unique is BIYT did classes are taught and performances are supported by  PROFESSIONAL THEATRE ARTISTS , oft Their volunteering time to bring the highest quality theatrical experience to international youth in Berlin. At the same time, through our  DIVERSE PARTICIPANTS , we Provide a platform for social exchange between different cultures, promo ting communication and understanding in the global language of English.

You see, our goal is not only at BIYT to Provide  OUTSTANDING THEATRE EDUCATION  but so to present high quality original performances for families and entertaining Both did are thought provoking. Our work is a  COLLABORATION between the imagination and energy of the youth we serve, the professional theater artists who support them, and the international heritage of the city where we reside.

Like all collaborations, BIYT needs the help of others to bring magic to the STAGE YOU CAN MAKE AN IMMEDIATE AND SIGNIFICANT IMPACT  with your support today!

OUR PROJECT

After months of training, devising, writing, and-let's face it-having a ton of fun, our yearly original production is beginning to come to life! The students are once again BIYT of tackling difficult issues through theater with the world premiere of INTO THE HAYSTACK! 

Into the Haystack by Isaiah Michalski 

and performed by Berlin Internatonal Youth Theatre

A dramatic investigation of surveillance in a supiciously normal society

May 22,23,24 friday, saturday and sunday at 19.00

Director: PriscillaBergey

Assistant Director: Lauren Miller

Costumes and Set: Lasha Rostobaia

Light Design: Katri Kuusimäki

Video: Alex Forge

Production Assitant Mark Sears

Image:Rebecca Fixemer

In digital era, privacy must be a priority. Is it just me, or is secret blanket surveillance obscenely outrageous? Al Gore

A dramatic investigation of surveillance in a suspiciously normal, yet surreal society where the citizens have given up all rights to privacy. They are ultimately safe-but safe from what? The police seem superflous, while the ominous Seeing-Men have complete control. A world that Kafka would recognize with a shudder.

Where an innocent group of kids discover a dangerous game, an idealistic young man turns into a scrupulous bully, and a fun loving grandma becomes the major suspect in an impossible crime.

In a world, not so different from ours, this is a place where the people are protected at all costs. Their crime rate is next to nothing, murders and thefts are something of the past. But so is privacy. The lack of privacy is the only reason that they are all so safe. So where does one draw the line? How does one decide to accept the ultimate surveillance that the government offers and forsake the basic right to privacy? When should a secret not be kept and the truth exposed? A diverse group of teenagers from all over the world ages 13-19, have created a play that explores exactly these questions.

RBB Radio eins- “BIYT- das ist Schüler theater auf höhem Niveau!”

"So what is to be done to restrain the champions, whom tend to trample upon the rest, whose eyes are fixed upon some ultimate golden future?" Isaiah Berlin, philosopher and political theorist 1909-97

This  ENSEMBLE WORK CREATED  will be devised and Performed by the young Participants of BIYT.

We must raise  € 500  before opening night to bring INTO THE HAYSTACK to life and  WE NEED YOUR HELP  to reach our goal!

WHAT YOUR GIFT WILL FUND

BIYT families pay a small monthly fee to participate in our weekly workshops Where They train in and create performance, lead by professional theater artists. Workshops begin in the fall and culminate with our original production in late spring. In order to keep this monthly cost low, we utilize the generosity of the Berlin theatrical community who donates our rehearsal and performance space. In addition, many of our professional teaching artists and support staff volunteer Their time and talents without pay. Even with this outpouring of practical support, the money we earn does not begin to cover the cost of bringing our yearly vision to the stage for the young people of BIYT.

With your help, we raise the money before opening night will go to fund production essentials: such as lighting and sound designers and operators, costumes and sets for our performers, a choreographer, and a stage manager, to mention only a few budget items. While so many of the staff BIYT Their volunteer time without pay, Those few professionals we hire to support our productions work well below industry standards for hep us to bring to the stage what our Participants have created.

It does not have to cost a king's ransom to fund a quality production, but it does need funding. For instance, a donation of € 25 will fund the creation of 1-2 costumes for a performer and for our production of INTO THE HAYSTACK and in this production, we need to build 40 costumes! Of course,  A DONATION OF ANY SIZE  helps us get that much closer to our goal, but for your generosity at the Following Amounts, we have some special gifts to say " THANK YOU! "

For your donation *  of  25 €,  you will receive one ticket to any performance of INTO THE HAYSTACK

For your donation *  of  € 50,  you will receive our popular and stylish BIYT Logo Canvas Shopping Tote! 

For your donation *  of  € 100,  you will receive a DVD of our spring production, INTO THE HAYSTACK

* Berlin International Youth Theatre is in the process of seeking non-profit status as of organization. We're not there yet! Unfortunately This Means did your gift this year is NOT tax-deductible, but the good karma it will bring you is priceless!

WHY YOUR GIFT MATTERS

Since 2010, Berlin International Youth Theatre has brought`  QUALITY EDUCATION THEATRE  to English speaking youth in Berlin. With your gift this year, you will be supporting our fourth original World Premiere production, written and created by the young people of BIYT. Many of our families have grown up participating in Berlin International Youth Theatre and we are Constantly looking for new ways to engage the community in a  MEANINGFUL AND LASTING  way. Your gift towards this year's production will enable us to continue our  LEGACY  of providing a unique and transformative theatrical experience to the international families of Berlin.

RBB Radio eins- “BIYT- das ist Schüler theater auf höhem Niveau!”
"So what is to be done to restrain the champions, whom tend to trample upon the rest, whose eyes are fixed upon some ultimate golden future?" Isaiah Berlin, philosopher and political theorist 1909-97This  ENSEMBLE WORK CREATED  will be devised and Performed by the young Participants of BIYT.We must raise  € 500  before opening night to bring INTO THE HAYSTACK to life and  WE NEED YOUR HELP  to reach our goal!WHAT YOUR GIFT WILL FUNDBIYT families pay a small monthly fee to participate in our weekly workshops Where They train in and create performance, lead by professional theater artists. Workshops begin in the fall and culminate with our original production in late spring. In order to keep this monthly cost low, we utilize the generosity of the Berlin theatrical community who donates our rehearsal and performance space. In addition, many of our professional teaching artists and support staff volunteer Their time and talents without pay. Even with this outpouring of practical support, the money we earn does not begin to cover the cost of bringing our yearly vision to the stage for the young people of BIYT.With your help, we raise the money before opening night will go to fund production essentials: such as lighting and sound designers and operators, costumes and sets for our performers, a choreographer, and a stage manager, to mention only a few budget items. While so many of the staff BIYT Their volunteer time without pay, Those few professionals we hire to support our productions work well below industry standards for hep us to bring to the stage what our Participants have created.It does not have to cost a king's ransom to fund a quality production, but it does need funding. For instance, a donation of € 25 will fund the creation of 1-2 costumes for a performer and for our production of INTO THE HAYSTACK and in this production, we need to build 40 costumes! Of course,  A DONATION OF ANY SIZE  helps us get that much closer to our goal, but for your generosity at the Following Amounts, we have some special gifts to say " THANK YOU! "For your donation *  of  25 €,  you will receive one ticket to any performance of INTO THE HAYSTACKFor your donation *  of  € 50,  you will receive our popular and stylish BIYT Logo Canvas Shopping Tote! For your donation *  of  € 100,  you will receive a DVD of our spring production, INTO THE HAYSTACK* Berlin International Youth Theatre is in the process of seeking non-profit status as of organization. We're not there yet! Unfortunately This Means did your gift this year is NOT tax-deductible, but the good karma it will bring you is priceless!WHY YOUR GIFT MATTERSSince 2010, Berlin International Youth Theatre has brought`  QUALITY EDUCATION THEATRE  to English speaking youth in Berlin. With your gift this year, you will be supporting our fourth original World Premiere production, written and created by the young people of BIYT. Many of our families have grown up participating in Berlin International Youth Theatre and we are Constantly looking for new ways to engage the community in a  MEANINGFUL AND LASTING  way. Your gift towards this year's production will enable us to continue our  LEGACY  of providing a unique and transformative theatrical experience to the international families of Berlin.

story:
My story:

My name is Alaja Oni Le’alla Badalich and I just turned 14.  I was born on December 5, 2000. I was 3 months early and weighed 2 pounds.  After two months in the hospital, I was brought home February 14, 2001. For being born so early I have athsma, but I don't let it get in the way of anything. I believe that things can hurt you but it's your choice for those things to hurt. Recently my asthma has come back, but I am battling through it. I'm currently attending my 8th grade year at Roosevelt Middle School and I am  an A and B student.

I believe family is one of the most  important things in life. I live with my mom, step-dad, and my 3 year old half-brother. My grandparents also live in Eugene too, while mostly all of my other relatives live in California. My family gives me so much support  and they inspire me everyday.  My best friend is also one of the most important people in my life. She supports me but also inspires me to jump through every obstacle in the way. She shares this passion of dance with  me. I truly can't imagine my life without my family or my best friend.



Alaja means understanding, Oni means strength, and  Le’alla means adoration. I think that as I grow older I will grow into these qualities by expressing who I am. “What expresses who I am ?“ You might be wondering. Well, for me, it’s dance. I have a passion for something so beautiful but painful.  When I dance, everything fades away in my life that is bothering me, even if it's dance stressing me out. I like to say that dance is my passion, expression, therapy, and I guess you could say my connection with the world.  Each movement, even if it's just a turn, a balance, a pointed foot, a plie, a ronde de jambe, or any movement that you think is small is actually connected to a smaller one. I think dance is also about connection. You have connected movements; your movements are connected to the music, but to make each movement fluid you must connect within yourself.  Each moment of the movement gets me closer to  finding  who I am inside and out. I know I am young, but I can’t picture myself not dancing. 


 My Training : 

 I train Monday through Saturday at Oregon Ballet academy. I take Pilates , Tap, Improvisation and Ballet. I dance about 23 hours in a week, or more if I have rehearsals. Summer of 2015, I studied at Texas Ballet Theater for 5 weeks and then Oregon Ballet Academy for the rest of the summer.  At home in Oregon Ballet Academy, my instructors are: John Greenback, Felicia Sanders, Adam kelly, and during the summer Carl Corry.  My instructors at Texas Ballet Theater were: Tim O’Keefe, Anna Donovan, Kathryn Warakomsky, Lyndette Galen, Carrie Cheng, Jan Miller, Steve Brule, Clara Cravey, John Grensback, Janie Parker, Adam Boreland, and more. My experience in Texas helped improve my dancing in all ways possible, I hope to do the same going to Ballet West. I competed in NAACP’s  ACT-SO competition in the category of dance. It is only for high-schoolers but they have a junior division. In 2014, I did an improvisation solo and won first place in the dance category and a gold medal. I am competing again this year on April 18th. In fall f 2014 at my studio ( Oregon ballet academy) we did Swan Lake and I was a Big Swan and Spanish princess. 




What I need:

I am raising $5,500 to Ballet Wes'ts six week long summer intensive program in Salt Lake City, Utah. This money will go to: Tuition, Housing, Airfare, Ballet Attire, Meal Plan, and Attire for Utah. Last year I was lucky enough to attend Texas Ballet Theater's 5 week long summer intensive with your help. Let's do it again! If you cannot donate, please spread the word by posting this on your social media or just telling people about it.


What you get : 

For $50 you get a Petite thanks from Alaja. This includes: one personal Thank You card, one LAJDANCE beaded bracelet, and one signed dance photo.

For $100 you get a Grande thanks from Alaja. This includes: one pair of signed pointe shoes, two signed dance photos, and one personal thank you letter.

For $500 you get Warm Up on POINTE. This includes: one video of Alaja explaining her workout and stretch routine, and five signed dance photos.

For $1000 you get a Lajerina gift package. This includes: one pair of signed pointe shoes, three signed danced photos, one personal hand written letter thanking you , one copy of Alaja's video, and one copy of Warm Up on POINTE.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Story:

Michael Dardant is a New Orleans Comedy Magician who's refined skill of sleight of hand has won him some of the most prestigious awards in Magic. He has now qualified to compete in what is considered to be the "Olympics of Magic" and can use your help to get there!



Michael tells people that he got his magic powers when he was 5 because of an incident in which he was bitten by a wizard!  But truthfully his talent stems from social anxiety and attention deficit disorder. Somehow this comedic cajun conjurer has brought his zany southern flair to the highest level of competition, becoming the most decorated magician in the country with over 20 first place National and International titles in Magic! This has brought him to the ultimate goal: F.I.S.M.!

FISM is the World Championship of Magic. It occurs every 3 years in a different country. Michael is one of only ten Americans selected to compete in this prestigious triennial event! With your help Michael can defend the USA's international magic reputation. According to Jon Stewart, this is becoming a serious issue!  Here is a link to the hilarious news segment called Lose Your Illusion!

The Impact:

What impacts people the most about magic is the way that magicians help people to believe in the impossible! An attempt at the World Championships of anything is generally considered to be an impossible dream.   Michael never believed he'd take it this far.  Why not believe it can go even farther?

Winning, even just performing at the level of FISM, will have a huge impact on Michael's career, literally multiplying his fan base and internet presence over night. But more importantly, it's one of those impossible dreams you only fantasize about as a kid. You can have an impact on a dream becoming reality and if you believe in his performance ability, help to have an impact on who gets to experience the magic!


The Need:

While Michael is indeed magical, he isn't Jesus or… Chris Angel, so he needs a plane ticket to cross the ocean. Seriously, Michael is taking on 2 categories, both close up magic and stage, and hopes to bring at least 2 assistants, so a week in Rimini, Italy plus travel expenses, registration, not to mention the cost of glitter, will come to over $10,000!  

Since the stakes are higher, we also have put together a team to help get the word out there, who are donating and/or severely cut their prices for their time and talents, all in an effort to do their part to  not only get Mike to F.I.S.M. but to increase public awareness of such a unique and prestigious event.

The Word:

Get the word out.  Post it, send it, talk it up!  Forward this to everyone and anyone who may be interested in this plight or would support the art of magic! Keep it circulating and keep checking back for updates.  Thank you all in advance for all of your help and support.  Please feel free to contact Michael with any questions or encouraging words! 

Here is a suggested post you can copy and paste:

How often do you know someone competing in the world championships of... well anything, let alone something as unique as magic! My friend, Michael Dardant has done just that! Since 2012 he has captured more than 20 first place titles which has led to the ultimate goal of the "Olympics of Magic" known as F.I.S.M. He could use your support.  Visit his campaign page and get the word out!

Indie GoGo Campaign Page: http://igg.me/p/help-michael-dardant-compete-at-fism-in-italy/x/166299

Face Book Like Page: https://www.facebook.com/MichaelDardantFISM2015


The Perks:. 

Digital Owl Shout Out - $10
You will be sent an owl, like in Harry Potter! But a digital version. Basically, you will get a "Thank You" via Face Book and Twitter.  Worth thousands of Internet points!  But worth more is the heart felt gratitude from a young wizard on his path to glory.

Postcards from Italy - $25
Yes, once there, Michael will actually find a post office, learn the Italian phrase for buying stamps, and thank you via postcard from the World Championships! it will be a sincere "Grazie!"straight from Italy to you.

Fleur de Lis Deck of Cards - $50
We apologize for the delay if you selected this perk.  We have had trouble with the original image so no products with this design have been printed. However we have commissioned an artist to create a new design, one that all will be proud to display in representation of Michael's  achievements!


NOLA Art - Print by Bethanie - $75

Your choice of 3  size 11 X 17 prints of original New Orleans photography by none other than the wonderful wife of the wizard, Bethanie Dardant. If you've followed Michael's career then you have probably seen some of his wife's amazing work.


Three DVD:  Nola Film Pack - $100

Receive three DVDs from the illustrious Michael Dardant filmography collection, Writer, Director,Actor in Three hilarious New Orleans Productions, Trailer Park Jesus, Bourbon Whiz and Below Sea Level! 

    


Special Edition Fork De Lis Bracelet - $150

Have you seen  the original bracelet Mike  wears, made from a fork? It's in the shape of a Fleur de  Lis and it's his good luck charm at every competition. It's made by French Quarter artist, Crazy Clyde Casey who will be constructing  a limited F.I.S.M. edition inscribed with the date of the World Championships to be worn proudly as a supporter of the art of magic! 


Get it all! - $300
Become a true magic lover by being one of the few who own the entire collection of the previously listed perks!

French Quarter Tour - $500
Michael Dardant is actually an official Tour Guide in the City of New Orleans, including the French Quarter. If you ever wanted a personal 1 to 2 hr. walk about with up to 25 people in the group, what better guide than the magician himself? 

An Intimate Evening of Magic - $1000

Having a dinner or cocktail party? Why not host a World Champion Magician?! Have Michael Dardant be the entertainment at your next dinner party. Performing prestidigitation and Mingle Magic to astound and enthrall your friends!


NOLA Burlesque Painting - $1500

Michael's friend and amazing New Orleans Artist, Jill  Grisamore will Painted a truly magical depiction of the Fleur de Tease Burlesque Cast, the troupe Michael has been performing with in the French Quarter for the past 9 years. It hangs above his awards in Magic! She will be making 5 more similar original paintings. They're lovely,  To give you an idea of Jill's Talent, below is a photo of Mike's (no, you can't have his!) 


Corporate Sponsor - $2500

For an entire YEAR, Michael will promote your company, in updates, videos  live shows, and on the home page of his new website soon to be released by Rhino Web Studios

For more details about a corporate sponsorship, contact us: MagicMikeEntertainment123@gmail.com


The Awards:

     


Michael Dardant - Awards and Achievements in Magic - 2012-2014

2012 Close Up Magic:

• 1st Place - Canadian Association of Magicians (CAM) – Ontario,,CA

• 1st Place - Gold Cups Championship, I.B.M. Convention - Norfolk, VA

• The Obie O'Brien People's Choice Award - I.B.M. Convention - Norfolk, VA

• 1st Place - 'Magic on the Beach' - Miami, Fl.

• 1st Place - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians (PCAM) - Seattle, WA

• Most Novel and Innovative Award - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians 

• Tony Eng People's Choice Award - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians (PCAM)

• 1st Place - Texas Association of Magicians (TAOM) - Houston, TX

• Master’s Degree - FFFF, The Original Close Up Convention - NY

2012 Stage Magic:

• 1st Place - Canadian Association of Magicians (CAM) - Ontario, CA

• 1st Place Comedy - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians (PCAM) - Seattle, WA

• Best Assistant Award (Kitty Kaos) - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians 

• Grand Prix - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians (PCAM) - Seattle, WA

• Competition Grand Champion - Texas Association of Magicians - Houston, TX

2013

• Doctorate Degree - FFFF, The Original Close Up Convention - NY

• 1st Place Micro Magic - Festival De Magie – Quebec City, CA

• 1st Place Mentalist Act – Festival De Magie – Quebec City, CA

• Featured Performer in the “Big Three” Close Up Show – IBM – Phoenix, AZ

• Worked with Apollo Robbins for the role of Card Sharp in the film, “Focus”

2014

• Most Valuable Performer - FFFF, The Original Close Up Convention - NY

• FISM Qualification at the I.B.M./S.A.M. North American  F.I.S.M. Championships 

• 1st Place - Gold Cups Championship, I.B.M. – St. Louis, MO

• 1st Place - "Bag of Tricks", PCAM - Vancouver, CA

• 1st Place Micro Magic - Festival De Magie – Quebec City, CA

• Grand Champion - Concours International De Magie Michel Cailloux - Quebec 

• Named International Ambassador to The Quebec Festival De Magie – Quebec

2015 

?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????


Thank you all in advance for all of your help and support.  Please feel free to contact Michael with any questions or encouraging words!

• Master’s Degree - FFFF, The Original Close Up Convention - NY
2012 Stage Magic:
• 1st Place - Canadian Association of Magicians (CAM) - Ontario, CA
• 1st Place Comedy - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians (PCAM) - Seattle, WA
• Best Assistant Award (Kitty Kaos) - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians 
• Grand Prix - Pacific Coast Association of Magicians (PCAM) - Seattle, WA
• Competition Grand Champion - Texas Association of Magicians - Houston, TX
2013
• Doctorate Degree - FFFF, The Original Close Up Convention - NY
• 1st Place Micro Magic - Festival De Magie – Quebec City, CA
• 1st Place Mentalist Act – Festival De Magie – Quebec City, CA
• Featured Performer in the “Big Three” Close Up Show – IBM – Phoenix, AZ
• Worked with Apollo Robbins for the role of Card Sharp in the film, “Focus”
2014
• Most Valuable Performer - FFFF, The Original Close Up Convention - NY
• FISM Qualification at the I.B.M./S.A.M. North American  F.I.S.M. Championships 
• 1st Place - Gold Cups Championship, I.B.M. – St. Louis, MO
• 1st Place - "Bag of Tricks", PCAM - Vancouver, CA
• 1st Place Micro Magic - Festival De Magie – Quebec City, CA
• Grand Champion - Concours International De Magie Michel Cailloux - Quebec 
• Named International Ambassador to The Quebec Festival De Magie – Quebec
2015

Thank you all in advance for all of your help and support.  Please feel free to contact Michael with any questions or encouraging words!

story:
The summer is a vital time to for dancers to advance their training. However, as my father was laid off of his job a year ago, money is very tight. And being only 15 years old I am not able to fund my summer studies solely relying on my minimum wage job that I go to on the weekends. 

I began my ballet training much later than most, at age 11.5. And due to financial constraints I had to stop and resume again a year later. But with some determination, I went from taking beginner level classes to Advanced within two years. I currently attend the Mid-Atantic Youth Ballet every day after school as well as weekend rehearsals, on a full ride scholarship. Without this scholarship, my ballet training would not have been possible.

In addition to ballet, I am a member of the Rho Kappa National Social Studies Honor Society, the National English Honor Society, the National Junior Japanese Honor Society, and the National Honor Society. I love writing and have been speaking Japanese for five years. Moreover, I have been on the honor role since I began school, and am a  current a member of Model United Nations as well as Key Club (a volunteer club). All in all, I try to work as hard as possible.

As most summer intensives are $3,000+ I hope that with some help, I  can reach my goal.

Thank you

story:
The Power of the Play

"The most combustible fraternal rapport since Sam Shepard's True West" -LA Times

With every performance, with every reading, with every production, the responses from audiences to "Derby Day" have propelled us to this point.  It's been inevitable.  From the first time it was read aloud we knew we had  found something special that resonated with us, something we wouldn't be able to let go of.  For us it meant forming a theatre company simply to produce it.  For the audience it meant wanting to see it again and share it with others.  In our own way, we each felt that we discovered something with this play and continue to discover more with each and every production. That is a powerful thing. "Derby Day" is a captivating  play and when people experience it they are moved to care about it, to want to see it go further.  As a company who came together in support of this play it's our mission to see that it reaches the greatest audience possible.  It's a timeless story, one that is strangely unique yet familiar.

The Story

The play opens in the luxury box of Arkansas' Oaklawn Racetrack where the estranged Ballard brother's have reunited after the burial of their father.  Growing up, the racetrack was the one place that the brothers could escape their violent, chaotic childhood, the one place their father was the head of their family and not the source of their abuse.  Becky, a single mother and their waitress, bears witness to their old wounds and becomes drawn in to their new hopes which culminate with the final race of the day, a long shot to realize their dreams.

The Edinburg Fringe Festival

We can't get enough of this play.  It's funny and raucous while at the same time dark and visceral with a breakneck pace.   A common audience response has been, "I didn't know theatre could be like this!", which is the greatest kind of experience to share.  

Whether you who are reading this have seen "Derby Day" or not, we hope that you are interested in joining us in our mission to share this play with the world.  There is no better way to give "Derby Day" that chance than by bringing it to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, the largest arts festival in the world with almost fifty thousand performers and over A MILLION audience members throughout the month of August.  We have already been accepted into the lineup of The Gilded Balloon, one of the four main venues of the festival, which is known for producing kinetic, challenging theatre, making it the perfect home for "Derby Day".

A Call to Action

Every play, every film that you have ever seen was made possible by the care and attention of individuals who championed and believed in them.  Every theatre company, no matter how small or large depends on it's family of supporters.   We have budgeted this production at close to $30k and have put our stated goal at $20k in order to avoid the 5% penalty that we incur should we not hit that higher amount.  We are so grateful and appreciative that you share our passion and will join us in championing "Derby Day". The horses have reached the starting gate!

story:
Flick & Julie Hit Edinburgh!

We're heading to the Edinburgh Fringe people, and we need your help!

  • Conceived, written and performed by Beth Granville and Gemma Layton, Flick & Julie: Pop-Up Penny Pinchers is a comedy sketch show which offers advice and tips on how to survive and thrive in austerity Britain.
  • The ultimate aim for us is world domination, erm...to get our show in front of the many industry professionals that head to Edinburgh in August, making the Fringe Festival an amazing opportunity to showcase the work we're doing and spread the Penny Pinching love.
  • However, it costs hard cash to get there, stay there, produce publicity and buy gin food, and this is where you can help...

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise will go towards...

  • Travel to and from Edinburgh
  • Accommodation whilst there
  • Posters, flyers and publicity
  • Living costs whilst there
  • Post-Fringe Festival therapy

As a thank you you get at least one (or more) of the following...

  • A warm fuzzy feeling
  • A thank you email with top money saving tips!
  • An 'Ow-cher'!
  • A private showing of Flick & Julie: Pop Up Penny Pinchers
  • Our first born children

About That Warm Fuzzy Feeling...

Ever flick through the channels looking for something hilarious to watch?

It's rubbish isn't it? How would you feel if you flicked through to find our crazy faces on your screen?!

Helping us get our show to as many people as possible is the first step in making that happen and it would mean the world to us if you helped out with a small (or MASSIVE) donation.

Desperate to Help but Strapped for Cash?

We totally get it! Where do you think the idea for this show came from in the first place?!

You can still help...

  • Share this campaign with your friends/family/the weird guy at the bus stop
  • Tweet about us! Share it on Facebook! Shout about it in the street!
  • There are buttons on Indiegogo that will help you share. (on social media...for the shouting in the street bit, you're on your own)

Thank You.        You.     Are.     Awesome.
