story:
Summary

My name is Alfie Noakes and I have been running open mic comedy shows for 5 years and doing so professionally since 2013 as the head honcho with We Are Funny Project.

Having worked in the media for over 10 years; a reporter on BBC Radio One, Documentary Producer/Director for MTV and with many credits on programmes aired on ITV, Channel 4 and Channel 5... somehow I found myself running comedy nights as a hobby. 

Right now The Project offers more stage time to open mike comedians than anyone else in the UK. Around 350 "spots" provided every month, 6 shows per week at 2 venues. 

Professional comedians regularly headline our free shows and work out their new material alongside proven hits. This is a practice which almost every top comedian needs to do before the big tour or the TV appearance.

Two years ago I set 3 initial targets for the We Are Funny Project.

The first was to massively increase the amount of stage time available to the open mic comedy community. Nothing is more helpful to a developing comedian than stage time. If they are prepared to make the effort then we are ready to provide the stage.

Target number 2 was to attract the largest numbers of real audience for our shows. We have a fine and enthusiastic audience at most shows and we can offer them even more.

With stages 1 and 2 completed this campaign is all about getting us to Stage 3. That is, to create a permanent venue and be able to offer the acts "pays days" as well as "play days".

Sadly, we have just been informed we are to lose our spiritual home for the last 5 years. We remain on excellent terms with the management it was a decision beyond all our control. So while one door closes we wish to kick another door in......hence this Campaign.

You can listen to a full interview with Alfie Noakes on the history of the We Are Funny Project and the ambitions for the Campaign here:

http://simoncaine.co.uk/ATI/AlfieNoakes

We wish to open a brand new comedy club on the London landscape and to make it so much more than that. To have total 24/7 access to a stage/room and fill it with comedy and more, drawing in our regular punters and a whole new audience. 

We wish to build and nourish and help the comedy/live performance scene to flourish.

Our USP is to provide the complete Progression platform over time. For example, an audience member at an open mic night might decide that they want to "give it a go" and then they come and do just that. They work hard across the circuit and we offer them a longer 10 minute spot when ready. They continue to work hard on our stage and on others, maybe getting a headline 20 minute set on an open night. This is ultimately driving towards a paid middle spot on a weekend and then lining up towards headlining a weekend show for a paying and comedy savvy crowd.

Naturally we'll be paying for the established professional acts to come and rock the room at the weekends and various other occasions.

We hope to create a venue holding around 150 seats with a separate bar/coffee area that will be a "hang-out" for not just the audience before and after the shows, but for creative and funny people, as well as the general public, in the day times.

Should we be fortunate enough to reach our stretch goal then we would hope to have a second, smaller room. This would be used for more niche intimate shows, classes, training and workshops. Fundamentally this would allow us to dramatically expand the range of options we can offer by virtue of a wonderful economy of scale.

The space would be used to host comedy Workshops and Courses; writing, performing, MCing, etc. We have run many of these already. We would expand the range of Workshops available by entering new territory with such classes as "How to Record and Stream a Podcast", and so much more. Artists and Producers would be invited to come and suggest what they would like to use our space for...and thus keep The Project at the cutting edge,  productive and self-funding.

We wish to create a space where we are set up for podcast recording and streaming. We hope to be fully wired for sound and vision in order to deliver comedy content across any platform.

I have brought some TV show production value to the open mic comedy scene. One way in which we have achieved this is by creating/producing a number of comedy "Formats" which forces the stand-ups to generate new material and deliver the freshest comedy shows in town. Our numerous formats include:

Challenge-  Requires hand-picked comics to produce 5 new minutes of stand-up to a given theme which they receive only after agreeing to perform, along the lines of “Virginity” or “Best Job Ever”.

Hecklers - Is the only comedy show in town where the audience are actively encouraged to abuse the acts and the acts fight back.

Swapsies - Is the show where 2 very different comedians are teamed up and challenged to write 5 brand new minutes of material for their partner, who MUST perform it. No matter what. What would you do if you could push any words into another persons mouth and make them regurgitate them.....?

Tales - A themed Storytelling night

Variety - A family friendly old school Variety show with twists, always themed and bizarre, musical comedy, improv, stand-up and a range of weirdness.

Sexes - Cross-dressing character Comedy at its’ finest.

Types - Lampooning Types of the “Arche” and “Stereo” forms.

Pitches - As though addressing a Hollywood mogul, here’s the idea for a crazy movie, from a stand-up comedian.

Wisdom - The comedian has 5 minutes to address the 5 year old version of themselves and can give them some life advice.

Bedtime - A wildly inappropriate bedtime story for the audience, not a child who is all tucked-up.

Stars - Review of the film career of a major star, one film at a time, to create a witty arc and retrospective.

The Project has the largest dedicated comedy meetup.com group in the country with around 1100 members who represent real audience/supporters and is growing all the time.

http://www.meetup.com/We-Are-Funny-Free-Comedy-Nights-Opp-Liverpool-St-Station/

We have over 2600 members of our closed Facebook group (comprised almost exclusively of acts)

https://www.facebook.com/groups/wearefunnyproject/

We have around 1700 "Likes" and a 4.9 out of 5 Star review status on our public Facebook page

https://www.facebook.com/thewearefunnyproject

Plus we have closing on 1500 Twitter Followers @werfunnyproject

These are clear signifiers of the support and reach we have from the comedy community, acts and audience alike.

Magic, music, cabaret and simple weirdness make regular appearances on our stage. Frequently funny, sometimes hilarious. It's not only stand up comedians who get the laughs with the We Are Funny Project.

The show(s) must go on......

We are fortunate to have the admiration and support of established, talented and famous comedians who have been generous in letting it be known that they support what we are trying to achieve. Some have already recorded endorsements for us and we understand that more will weigh-in as the Campaign develops into July 2015.

The open mic comedy community is extraordinarily diverse and we are fortunate to have many volunteers to assist us with matters ranging from PR to photography, business advice to installing sound systems...there is a lot of community support built in to the operation, with services offered to us for free or at a considerable discount. We can get great "bang for our buck" thanks to the help of these good people.

Since the claim to be "Funny" is in our very title, this Campaign is designed to entertain and amuse and as such we have hatched a "mascot" in the form of Cheeky Martini. Our mascot will be undertaking some silly, even dangerous, missions over the Campaign period.

However, his is an emerging character and as time goes on, new layers to his weirdness, wit, wisdom and boldness will be revealed. Cheeky Martini has every likelihood to go viral, trend on Twitter and catch the interest of not just the supportive comics and comedy fans but the mainstream press as well.

Cheeky Martini will become especially visible each time that a funding milestone is reached, keeping the Campaign fresh and entertaining throughout. Fellow artists are lining up behind us to help Cheeky Martini do, and be, all that he can be. 

At the end of the day it's about creating opportunities and bringing great laughs.

What We Need 

We are hoping to raise £90, 000. Where possible we would source from other members of the community. If a comedian is also an electrician for his day job we'd look to hire that person first, assuming that they are properly qualified and reasonably priced.
Funds will be used to secure a venue, with the lions' share going on advance rent and deposit. London is not a cheap City.
However, by the day we open for business we shall need to have:
* Advertising, printed publicity materials and to have re-vamped the website
* Acquired food, alcohol and entertainments licenses from the local authority
* Fitted a stage with quality lighting arrangement
* Furnished the performance space with around 150 linked chairs and a number of tables for drinks and food
* Installed a computer network for general work, editing, uploading and keeping on top of social media, marketing and VT production
* Additional microphones and cameras so that performances, podcasts, lectures and more can be recorded/streamed at a very high standard
* Re-modeled and decorated the venue/room to make it ideal for the purpose of hosting live performances and gatherings
* Furnished and decorated the bar/cafe area with comfortable seating and space for the customers (though we would wish for the space to be used by local artists to display their work for sale and create a flow of changing decor while working with our community)
* Installed and stocked a kitchen, with food display and serving area
* Fixed both exterior and interior signage and on-site advertising for our own events
* Installed and stocked the bar in a fashion that we can serve many people simultaneously, as we will surely have clear "rush" periods for refreshments
* Cash registers, electronic point of sale equipment, phones, internet, etc
* Deposits for key utilities; gas, electricity and water
* Our basic office furniture which is needed to work, desk and chairs, folders, shelving, etc
* Paid public insurance premiums
* Security systems; alarms, CCTV, hard drive recorder
* Paid professional fees such as legal costs and accountancy
* Obtained necessary items such as tools, ladders, cleaning equipment, etc
* Addressed additional elements such as soundproofing, coat check, box office, etc
* Last but not least, some of the our Perks are amazing but will cost some money to deliver upon and this has to be taken into account. Examples, teachers would still need to be paid to run Workshops. There will be a clear cost in putting on the super-charged opening weekend shows for which we hope to advance sell the tickets to our supporters here.

What You Get

The We Are Funny Project is not asking for something for nothing. We believe that our major appeal is "the big picture" of creating a hub that is committed to comedy in particular and the arts in general. 
The world will be a better place with a one-stop-shop for comedy and comedians of all levels in addition to the learning and production opportunities we will offer. Besides, a welcoming cafe and bar sitting within such a special place will have its' own appeal.
However, we have some special treats for our supporters, be they performers or patrons!
A small donation means that you will get a special video message from Cheeky Martini himself, a larger donation means (if you are London local) the man himself will come and do some poor quality cleaning of your house for an extremely limited time period. he will entertain you in the process of course, live and in the flesh.
There are comedy CDs, DVDs and books as produced by our friends, autographed as you request.
We are offering places on the variety of Workshops we'll be holding in the coming months, some will happen even before we open up the venue itself. Tickets for future shows will be available to donors, or if you are feeling extra generous you could have a pair of tickets for life, for any show we ever stage, the "Golden" tickets.
Maybe you'd like to have the full run of the club for a day and a night and have our complete support in you running your own event, no matter what it is?
We'll be changing the Perks on a regular basis, offering different incentives to get involved. Some will be small but worthy, others might have a high value and will be offered at an appropriate rate.
We hope that some of our supporters will offer up goods and services for us to make available to future donors and keep the Campaign running, ever fresh and rewarding.

If We Do Not Reach Our Target....

Then we shall have to re-consider the plan and strategy in view of the finance we have been able to raise. Perhaps we could still achieve the goal but with a smaller room, or compromising on locating to the precise Central London area that we have in mind.
The funds that are raised would most certainly be used to further the mission to open a new, complete progression, comedy venue. However, the ambition and scale would clearly need to be scaled down. It may be a case of seeking private investment to supplement the Crowdfunded money.

If We Exceed Our Target....

Then we will be very happy bunnies indeed and would look to have a second, smaller, room available in the club. This would mean we would be more free to run rehearsals, weekly courses and the like, keeping the main room entirely free for bigger events and larger crowds. 
This would create an economy of scale so that we could offer much more, for only a little extra investment and space. We would stagger shows and classes so that there would be a steady flow through the bar and cafe rather than huge crowds and queues for short periods, then relative quiet, allowing for better service and improved business practice.

The Impact

Our new venue is designed to offer the most for the newest acts on the scene. Good stage, good crowds, good company...opportunities to come and watch the best; be taught by the funniest and most talented. Our mission is to generate more and more quality laughter in the world and we know just the people who want to do that....comedians. And those who love them.
Five years ago it was two shows a month in the basement of a pub. In May 2015 we ran 27 different shows, including 4 Edinburgh Previews with major comedy names, plus a Workshop on "How To MC A Comedy Show".
Even with around 350 "spots" each month we are still over-subscribed and The Project is well-regarded by almost everyone who performs with us. 
In a world where we are looking at the screen so very often it's a fine thing to see some vital performances, laugh so hard that your bum wiggles and keep live comedy strong and healthy. We have been with the grass roots for a while and some of our friends are truly emerging talents....we have the knowledge, the contacts, the audience, the vision and ambition. It's the venue that is the issue.
The Project is keen to bring stand-up comedy to young people whether by taking Workshops into schools or opening our doors to youth groups during the days in school holidays we feel we can offer a wonderfully fun interest for the very newest generation of potential comedians and performers. 

Risks & Challenges

The single biggest issue is the "chicken and egg" matter of the Venue. We need to have funds in place so we can move like lightning when we locate the ideal, available home for the project.
We recently identified a near-perfect venue in all regards; size, set-up, location, history and reputation as a live events setting. The rent was very expensive. However little would have needed to be done with regard to re-modelling so one saving would have off-set the other cost. 
This venue was taken up by a third party extremely quickly. We are able to use the numbers and stats as a fair comparative for what we would be looking for and would need to pay.
The fact is that we will need to have the funds in place so we can secure the right venue, when we find it, fast and efficiently. 
It is simply not practical to find the venue, ask them to wait 2 - 3 months while we set up and run a campaign, and hope we raise the funds. It really has to be the case of Crowdfund now and be ready to pounce when the time is right.
We believe that it will be a tough ask to fund a Central London venue only by ticketed events. Our business model requires we have various revenue streams and not reliant on any single one. Bar and food sales will be significant. Workshops and courses, renting out the space for photo-shoots, lectures, rehearsals etc will also be vital.
We will have a wonderful space, fully kitted and easy on the eye. It should be used as much as possible by a diverse range of people, all paying in (one way or another) to keep the business viable. We will then have the luxury of supplementing open mic nights, or offering free support to great people with good ideas, but little money....
The challenge is to strike the right balance between profitable commercial ventures and supporting less wealthy, but worthy, events and people.
We believe that we have a great range of people who are professionals in the area of property, event management, marketing and purely enthusiastic about this venture. This will help to ensure that we can secure the right venue at the right time and then fill it with the perfect blend of events, some profitable and some for the love of the art. At the end of the day we will never lose sight that it is Show "Business" and without that understanding our days would be numbered. We are in this for the long game.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you haven't the money, or the will to donate your money, that's OK with us of course. There are other ways to help us. 
* Offer your time. Set aside perhaps two hours and find your own ways of spreading the word about the Campaign. Perhaps write a piece about it on a website, for a local newspaper, email the details to 100 friends, call your wealthy Great Aunt Mable and ask her to donate. Only you know best what your time could produce. The objectives are fundamentally to raise awareness and ultimately finance.
* Share our postings, Twitter and Facebook, with positive comments about what we are doing and who we are.
* Do you have contacts in the media that might be interested in running a story on us? Let them know of this strange story; Cheeky Martini, celebrity connections and entertaining content. Increased exposure in mainstream radio, TV and print will be essential as the Campaign develops over the 5 weeks.
* Can you get unusual access somewhere that Cheeky Martini could make an appearance? Or maybe have some creative ideas for what Cheeky Martini might pop up for? He's a developing character so think big!
* Identify 5 people that you know personally and tell them about this campaign, ask them to support it. Ask them to "Share" the photos and video clips that we will be posting. Ask these 5 people to personally ask 5 of their own friends and family to do the same. The cumulative effect will be invaluable in drawing attention to the campaign and spreading the word, getting us trending.....
* Can you offer skills or goods to support us? If you work at music festival could you perhaps blag some free tickets that we could offer up as a Reward to raise money this way? Perhaps you work in a lovely hotel and could offer a weekend break as a Perk for us to offer? If you are a property agent, could you help us to locate the venue or keep your eyes peeled? There are so many skills that could help, so many goods and good times that could Reward our supporters.
story_txt:
Summary
 My name is Alfie Noakes and I have been running open mic comedy shows for 5 years and doing so professionally since 2013 as the head honcho with We Are Funny Project.
Having worked in the media for over 10 years; a reporter on BBC Radio One, Documentary Producer/Director for MTV and with many credits on programmes aired on ITV, Channel 4 and Channel 5... somehow I found myself running comedy nights as a hobby. 
Right now The Project offers more stage time to open mike comedians than anyone else in the UK. Around 350 "spots" provided every month, 6 shows per week at 2 venues. 
Professional comedians regularly headline our free shows and work out their new material alongside proven hits. This is a practice which almost every top comedian needs to do before the big tour or the TV appearance.

Two years ago I set 3 initial targets for the We Are Funny Project.
The first was to massively increase the amount of stage time available to the open mic comedy community. Nothing is more helpful to a developing comedian than stage time. If they are prepared to make the effort then we are ready to provide the stage.
Target number 2 was to attract the largest numbers of real audience for our shows. We have a fine and enthusiastic audience at most shows and we can offer them even more.
With stages 1 and 2 completed this campaign is all about getting us to Stage 3. That is, to create a permanent venue and be able to offer the acts "pays days" as well as "play days".
Sadly, we have just been informed we are to lose our spiritual home for the last 5 years. We remain on excellent terms with the management it was a decision beyond all our control. So while one door closes we wish to kick another door in......hence this Campaign.
You can listen to a full interview with Alfie Noakes on the history of the We Are Funny Project and the ambitions for the Campaign here:
http://simoncaine.co.uk/ATI/AlfieNoakes

We wish to open a brand new comedy club on the London landscape and to make it so much more than that. To have total 24/7 access to a stage/room and fill it with comedy and more, drawing in our regular punters and a whole new audience. 
We wish to build and nourish and help the comedy/live performance scene to flourish.
Our USP is to provide the complete Progression platform over time. For example, an audience member at an open mic night might decide that they want to "give it a go" and then they come and do just that. They work hard across the circuit and we offer them a longer 10 minute spot when ready. They continue to work hard on our stage and on others, maybe getting a headline 20 minute set on an open night. This is ultimately driving towards a paid middle spot on a weekend and then lining up towards headlining a weekend show for a paying and comedy savvy crowd.
Naturally we'll be paying for the established professional acts to come and rock the room at the weekends and various other occasions.
We hope to create a venue holding around 150 seats with a separate bar/coffee area that will be a "hang-out" for not just the audience before and after the shows, but for creative and funny people, as well as the general public, in the day times.
Should we be fortunate enough to reach our stretch goal then we would hope to have a second, smaller room. This would be used for more niche intimate shows, classes, training and workshops. Fundamentally this would allow us to dramatically expand the range of options we can offer by virtue of a wonderful economy of scale.
The space would be used to host comedy Workshops and Courses; writing, performing, MCing, etc. We have run many of these already. We would expand the range of Workshops available by entering new territory with such classes as "How to Record and Stream a Podcast", and so much more. Artists and Producers would be invited to come and suggest what they would like to use our space for...and thus keep The Project at the cutting edge,  productive and self-funding.
We wish to create a space where we are set up for podcast recording and streaming. We hope to be fully wired for sound and vision in order to deliver comedy content across any platform.
I have brought some TV show production value to the open mic comedy scene. One way in which we have achieved this is by creating/producing a number of comedy "Formats" which forces the stand-ups to generate new material and deliver the freshest comedy shows in town. Our numerous formats include:
Challenge-  Requires hand-picked comics to produce 5 new minutes of stand-up to a given theme which they receive only after agreeing to perform, along the lines of “Virginity” or “Best Job Ever”.
Hecklers - Is the only comedy show in town where the audience are actively encouraged to abuse the acts and the acts fight back.
Swapsies - Is the show where 2 very different comedians are teamed up and challenged to write 5 brand new minutes of material for their partner, who MUST perform it. No matter what. What would you do if you could push any words into another persons mouth and make them regurgitate them.....?

Tales - A themed Storytelling night
Variety - A family friendly old school Variety show with twists, always themed and bizarre, musical comedy, improv, stand-up and a range of weirdness.
Sexes - Cross-dressing character Comedy at its’ finest.
Types - Lampooning Types of the “Arche” and “Stereo” forms.
Pitches - As though addressing a Hollywood mogul, here’s the idea for a crazy movie, from a stand-up comedian.
Wisdom - The comedian has 5 minutes to address the 5 year old version of themselves and can give them some life advice.
Bedtime - A wildly inappropriate bedtime story for the audience, not a child who is all tucked-up.
Stars - Review of the film career of a major star, one film at a time, to create a witty arc and retrospective.

The Project has the largest dedicated comedy meetup.com group in the country with around 1100 members who represent real audience/supporters and is growing all the time.
http://www.meetup.com/We-Are-Funny-Free-Comedy-Nights-Opp-Liverpool-St-Station/
We have over 2600 members of our closed Facebook group (comprised almost exclusively of acts)
https://www.facebook.com/groups/wearefunnyproject/
We have around 1700 "Likes" and a 4.9 out of 5 Star review status on our public Facebook page
https://www.facebook.com/thewearefunnyproject
Plus we have closing on 1500 Twitter Followers @werfunnyproject
These are clear signifiers of the support and reach we have from the comedy community, acts and audience alike.
Magic, music, cabaret and simple weirdness make regular appearances on our stage. Frequently funny, sometimes hilarious. It's not only stand up comedians who get the laughs with the We Are Funny Project.
The show(s) must go on......
We are fortunate to have the admiration and support of established, talented and famous comedians who have been generous in letting it be known that they support what we are trying to achieve. Some have already recorded endorsements for us and we understand that more will weigh-in as the Campaign develops into July 2015.
The open mic comedy community is extraordinarily diverse and we are fortunate to have many volunteers to assist us with matters ranging from PR to photography, business advice to installing sound systems...there is a lot of community support built in to the operation, with services offered to us for free or at a considerable discount. We can get great "bang for our buck" thanks to the help of these good people.
Since the claim to be "Funny" is in our very title, this Campaign is designed to entertain and amuse and as such we have hatched a "mascot" in the form of Cheeky Martini. Our mascot will be undertaking some silly, even dangerous, missions over the Campaign period.
However, his is an emerging character and as time goes on, new layers to his weirdness, wit, wisdom and boldness will be revealed. Cheeky Martini has every likelihood to go viral, trend on Twitter and catch the interest of not just the supportive comics and comedy fans but the mainstream press as well.
Cheeky Martini will become especially visible each time that a funding milestone is reached, keeping the Campaign fresh and entertaining throughout. Fellow artists are lining up behind us to help Cheeky Martini do, and be, all that he can be. 
At the end of the day it's about creating opportunities and bringing great laughs.   
What We Need 

We are hoping to raise £90, 000. Where possible we would source from other members of the community. If a comedian is also an electrician for his day job we'd look to hire that person first, assuming that they are properly qualified and reasonably priced.
Funds will be used to secure a venue, with the lions' share going on advance rent and deposit. London is not a cheap City.
However, by the day we open for business we shall need to have:
* Advertising, printed publicity materials and to have re-vamped the website
* Acquired food, alcohol and entertainments licenses from the local authority
* Fitted a stage with quality lighting arrangement
* Furnished the performance space with around 150 linked chairs and a number of tables for drinks and food
* Installed a computer network for general work, editing, uploading and keeping on top of social media, marketing and VT production
* Additional microphones and cameras so that performances, podcasts, lectures and more can be recorded/streamed at a very high standard
* Re-modeled and decorated the venue/room to make it ideal for the purpose of hosting live performances and gatherings
* Furnished and decorated the bar/cafe area with comfortable seating and space for the customers (though we would wish for the space to be used by local artists to display their work for sale and create a flow of changing decor while working with our community)
* Installed and stocked a kitchen, with food display and serving area
* Fixed both exterior and interior signage and on-site advertising for our own events

* Installed and stocked the bar in a fashion that we can serve many people simultaneously, as we will surely have clear "rush" periods for refreshments
* Cash registers, electronic point of sale equipment, phones, internet, etc
* Deposits for key utilities; gas, electricity and water
* Our basic office furniture which is needed to work, desk and chairs, folders, shelving, etc
* Paid public insurance premiums
* Security systems; alarms, CCTV, hard drive recorder
* Paid professional fees such as legal costs and accountancy
* Obtained necessary items such as tools, ladders, cleaning equipment, etc
* Addressed additional elements such as soundproofing, coat check, box office, etc
* Last but not least, some of the our Perks are amazing but will cost some money to deliver upon and this has to be taken into account. Examples, teachers would still need to be paid to run Workshops. There will be a clear cost in putting on the super-charged opening weekend shows for which we hope to advance sell the tickets to our supporters here.

What You GetThe We Are Funny Project is not asking for something for nothing. We believe that our major appeal is "the big picture" of creating a hub that is committed to comedy in particular and the arts in general. 
The world will be a better place with a one-stop-shop for comedy and comedians of all levels in addition to the learning and production opportunities we will offer. Besides, a welcoming cafe and bar sitting within such a special place will have its' own appeal.
However, we have some special treats for our supporters, be they performers or patrons!
A small donation means that you will get a special video message from Cheeky Martini himself, a larger donation means (if you are London local) the man himself will come and do some poor quality cleaning of your house for an extremely limited time period. he will entertain you in the process of course, live and in the flesh.
There are comedy CDs, DVDs and books as produced by our friends, autographed as you request.
We are offering places on the variety of Workshops we'll be holding in the coming months, some will happen even before we open up the venue itself. Tickets for future shows will be available to donors, or if you are feeling extra generous you could have a pair of tickets for life, for any show we ever stage, the "Golden" tickets.
Maybe you'd like to have the full run of the club for a day and a night and have our complete support in you running your own event, no matter what it is?
We'll be changing the Perks on a regular basis, offering different incentives to get involved. Some will be small but worthy, others might have a high value and will be offered at an appropriate rate.
We hope that some of our supporters will offer up goods and services for us to make available to future donors and keep the Campaign running, ever fresh and rewarding.
If We Do Not Reach Our Target....
Then we shall have to re-consider the plan and strategy in view of the finance we have been able to raise. Perhaps we could still achieve the goal but with a smaller room, or compromising on locating to the precise Central London area that we have in mind.
The funds that are raised would most certainly be used to further the mission to open a new, complete progression, comedy venue. However, the ambition and scale would clearly need to be scaled down. It may be a case of seeking private investment to supplement the Crowdfunded money.

If We Exceed Our Target....
Then we will be very happy bunnies indeed and would look to have a second, smaller, room available in the club. This would mean we would be more free to run rehearsals, weekly courses and the like, keeping the main room entirely free for bigger events and larger crowds. 
This would create an economy of scale so that we could offer much more, for only a little extra investment and space. We would stagger shows and classes so that there would be a steady flow through the bar and cafe rather than huge crowds and queues for short periods, then relative quiet, allowing for better service and improved business practice.
   The Impact
Our new venue is designed to offer the most for the newest acts on the scene. Good stage, good crowds, good company...opportunities to come and watch the best; be taught by the funniest and most talented. Our mission is to generate more and more quality laughter in the world and we know just the people who want to do that....comedians. And those who love them.
Five years ago it was two shows a month in the basement of a pub. In May 2015 we ran 27 different shows, including 4 Edinburgh Previews with major comedy names, plus a Workshop on "How To MC A Comedy Show".
Even with around 350 "spots" each month we are still over-subscribed and The Project is well-regarded by almost everyone who performs with us. 
In a world where we are looking at the screen so very often it's a fine thing to see some vital performances, laugh so hard that your bum wiggles and keep live comedy strong and healthy. We have been with the grass roots for a while and some of our friends are truly emerging talents....we have the knowledge, the contacts, the audience, the vision and ambition. It's the venue that is the issue.
The Project is keen to bring stand-up comedy to young people whether by taking Workshops into schools or opening our doors to youth groups during the days in school holidays we feel we can offer a wonderfully fun interest for the very newest generation of potential comedians and performers. 
    Risks & Challenges
The single biggest issue is the "chicken and egg" matter of the Venue. We need to have funds in place so we can move like lightning when we locate the ideal, available home for the project.
We recently identified a near-perfect venue in all regards; size, set-up, location, history and reputation as a live events setting. The rent was very expensive. However little would have needed to be done with regard to re-modelling so one saving would have off-set the other cost. 
This venue was taken up by a third party extremely quickly. We are able to use the numbers and stats as a fair comparative for what we would be looking for and would need to pay.
The fact is that we will need to have the funds in place so we can secure the right venue, when we find it, fast and efficiently. 
It is simply not practical to find the venue, ask them to wait 2 - 3 months while we set up and run a campaign, and hope we raise the funds. It really has to be the case of Crowdfund now and be ready to pounce when the time is right.
We believe that it will be a tough ask to fund a Central London venue only by ticketed events. Our business model requires we have various revenue streams and not reliant on any single one. Bar and food sales will be significant. Workshops and courses, renting out the space for photo-shoots, lectures, rehearsals etc will also be vital.
We will have a wonderful space, fully kitted and easy on the eye. It should be used as much as possible by a diverse range of people, all paying in (one way or another) to keep the business viable. We will then have the luxury of supplementing open mic nights, or offering free support to great people with good ideas, but little money....
The challenge is to strike the right balance between profitable commercial ventures and supporting less wealthy, but worthy, events and people.
We believe that we have a great range of people who are professionals in the area of property, event management, marketing and purely enthusiastic about this venture. This will help to ensure that we can secure the right venue at the right time and then fill it with the perfect blend of events, some profitable and some for the love of the art. At the end of the day we will never lose sight that it is Show "Business" and without that understanding our days would be numbered. We are in this for the long game.   Other Ways You Can Help
If you haven't the money, or the will to donate your money, that's OK with us of course. There are other ways to help us. 
* Offer your time. Set aside perhaps two hours and find your own ways of spreading the word about the Campaign. Perhaps write a piece about it on a website, for a local newspaper, email the details to 100 friends, call your wealthy Great Aunt Mable and ask her to donate. Only you know best what your time could produce. The objectives are fundamentally to raise awareness and ultimately finance.

* Share our postings, Twitter and Facebook, with positive comments about what we are doing and who we are.
* Do you have contacts in the media that might be interested in running a story on us? Let them know of this strange story; Cheeky Martini, celebrity connections and entertaining content. Increased exposure in mainstream radio, TV and print will be essential as the Campaign develops over the 5 weeks.
* Can you get unusual access somewhere that Cheeky Martini could make an appearance? Or maybe have some creative ideas for what Cheeky Martini might pop up for? He's a developing character so think big!
* Identify 5 people that you know personally and tell them about this campaign, ask them to support it. Ask them to "Share" the photos and video clips that we will be posting. Ask these 5 people to personally ask 5 of their own friends and family to do the same. The cumulative effect will be invaluable in drawing attention to the campaign and spreading the word, getting us trending.....

* Can you offer skills or goods to support us? If you work at music festival could you perhaps blag some free tickets that we could offer up as a Reward to raise money this way? Perhaps you work in a lovely hotel and could offer a weekend break as a Perk for us to offer? If you are a property agent, could you help us to locate the venue or keep your eyes peeled? There are so many skills that could help, so many goods and good times that could Reward our supporters.

story:
Sexpelliarmus II!

Last year's Atlanta Nerdlesque hit is back! Sexpelliarmus: A Whimsical Wizarding Burlesque Revue is now at The New Atlanta Shakespeare Tavern. We are extremely excited about being in one of Atlanta's destination theaters, but as our production grows, so do our production expenses. That's where you come in!

What Do We Need?

As a collective of passionate, like-minded nerds and geeks who all would have gone to Hogwarts for college if they accepted FAFSA, we fund the entirety of our production out of our pockets.   We desperately need assistance with production and company expenses, to step up the level and quality of immersive experience we provide for you, our audience.  The production expenses include:

  • Backgrounds
  • Printed promotional materials
  • Props
  • Graphic design
  • Administrative work
  • Merchandise and other swag
  • Performer travel expenses

    • Why Do We Need It?

    Our goal has always been to provide our audience with the highest quality immersive experience, and to pay our staff, artists and performers a wage worthy of their level of talent.  However, with a company that starts out with 0 capital, and production costs funded entirely by the staff and crew, ticket sales only cover expenses in part, leaving us in the red. These funds, while providing you with great shwag, bonus opportunities, and awesome prizes, help us to continue to bring a level of production worthy of our audience. 


    Why Sexpelliarmus?

    The history of burlesque as a genre is rooted in parody. Nerdlesque as a burlesque subgenre captures this spirit in a modern way. As Atlanta's own nerdlesque performance collective, the Hysteria Machines production company seeks to bring the past to the present and engage the incredible nerd community that Atlanta boasts.  As a performance collective of like-minded geeks and nerds of all fandoms, Hysteria Machines works tirelessly on production of their shows throughout the entire year.  Our ultimate goal with Sexpelliarmus II: to immerse our audience in the whimsical wizarding world, while bringing a production quality worthy of the Shakespeare Tavern stage, and keep our artistic staff, cast and crew well-fed and happy. 

            


    Risks & Challenges

    Moving to a larger venue brings new challenges and obstacles. In order to create a show that befits a venue like The New Atlanta Shakespeare Tavern, we have more to worry about than Death Eaters and Dementors.

    • Larger stage requires more set pieces and backgrounds
    • Larger seating area makes creating our signature immersive environment more difficult. This requires additional decorations and staffing.
    • Our cast has expanded with new original numbers including the lovely ladies of the Beauxbatons Academy of Magic

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone can provide funding, but you can still help make this show a success

    • Let your friends know about this campaign. Share and promote us.
    • Tell people about the show. If you've seen it, tell them about it. If you want to see it, let us know!
    • Like our page on Facebook. Reach out to the performers. We want to know how excited you are for this show!

    This is our passion!

    We are passionate about the Wizarding World, and bringing our audience along with us into it.  Many of us grew up on this iconic series, have read the books and seen the movies dozens of times, and have had our fair share of butterbeer, chocolate frogs and Bertie Bots Beans. You can help us  continue to grow this passion into a production that encourages nostalgia, engages our audience in intelligent, sexy, comedic entertainment, and turns even the most frightening dementors and Death Eaters away with our sheer joy!

story:
"HOME is something I found when I lost mine."

HOUSE #30 is the latest solo theatre piece written and performed by Mik Kuhlman, taking place in and around a suspended silk house created by textile artist Patricia Toovey. This is a personal story about losing a house to a fire and finding home in the ashes. It's filled with island lore, ghost stories, physicality, humor, and heart.

Mik has gathered a beautifully talented team of professionals from Seattle and New York. We are running this campaign to raise the funds necessary to cover their labor and material costs.


Your support fuels Independent Theatre.


Two years in the making, HOUSE #30 has already been profound in its journey. It continues to resonate with audiences, from its conception on Vashon Island to sections presented around a Northwest campfire; in a Manhattan gallery, Brooklyn loft, and Portland living room; and as part of New York's Artistic New Directions GO SOLO Festival. We are excited to present HOUSE #30, in its entirety, to Seattle audiences for the first time, then to NYC and on a path to tour.


AJ EPSTEIN presents HOUSE #30 at West of Lenin JUNE 25-29, 2015

Artistic Team:

Creator: Mik Kuhlman
Director: Jennifer Jasper
Visual Designer: Patricia Toovey
Sound Designer: Michael Keck
Lighting Designer: AJ Epstein

with additional musical contributions by Gretta Harley & Lesley Kernochan 

Production Team: Susanna Burney, Bob Pore, Brendan Hogan, Meg McHutchison


Please visit our website at: house30.org


No contribution is too small. Every contribution, even $5, is a tremendous help, it adds up! Your donations will assist House #30 to become fully realized and hopefully generate dialogue around our relationships to home. Thank you for supporting independent theater.

Other Ways You Can Help: 

We understand that sometimes people can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean you can't help. In-Kind Donations (Ferry tickets, feeding the team during tech rehearsals, production assistance, promotion, sharing on social media, or any additional support you can leverage.) Talk to us. Please contact: Production Liaison, Susanna Burney at susburney@gmail.com


Here's some video and websites you can visit:

This Project:   House30.org
Concurrent project, SHADOWS: A Live Art Installation
shot @ NOoSPHERE Arts in Manhattan by Pocket Media:
 http://thepmg.vzaar.me/2364677  
Past Projects:  Vimeo.com/mikkuhlman/videos
And a website:  www.mikkuhlman.com

Residency at Hanna Barn Studios (Vashon, WA)
Video by Coco Conroy/ Photos by Michelle Bates


Mik Kuhlman Productions is an Associated Program of Shunpike.
All donations are tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law.


From everyone in House #30, we graciously thank you.

story:
Be a Part of Canadian Cultural History and Become a FOUNDING FOSTER FRIEND WITH BENEFITS!


How to Donate:

  • Select your preferred level of donation/perk. ------>
  • To donate more than the minimum level of each perk, select "additional gift" which you will be able to do when going through the contribution process.
NEW! All Titter donations will receive an autographed picture of Norm Foster.

NEW! All Snicker donations will receive an autographed picture of Norm Foster and an autographed manuscript of one of Norm's plays...of your choosing!

NEW! All Guffaw donations will receive an autographed picture of Norm Foster, a world premiere Norm Foster script autographed by Norm and the cast, and an autographed season poster!

All levels of donations have new added perks, so read through them carefully to ensure you are receiving your preferred perks!


Our Story

Who are we?

  • The Norm Foster Theatre Festival is a theatre company inspired by the work of internationally renowned Canadian playwright Norm Foster. It is our mission to showcase the heart and humour of Foster’s writing in a dedicated environment, employing the finest Canadian theatre practitioners and to foster and support emerging and established Canadian playwrights interested in stories that are entertaining but also deeply meaningful to and reflective of our audience.

  • In the past 4 years, as Norm and Patricia toured On a First Name Basis throughout Ontario and other parts of Canada as well as internationally, they became aware that many in the audience had come to the theatre for the first time in their lives – and not just 20 somethings but older working class people.  Time and again, they were told that their audience’s experience at the show was a revelation.  These new theatregoers were moved by the fact that their lives, loves and heartaches were reflected on the stage and delightfully surprised at how they could be in tears one moment and exploding in laughter the next. 

  • At The Foster Festival, we aim to celebrate the importance of popular, heartfelt theatre in the lives of everyday people and its resonance with audiences. In these communities, along with the numerous others Norm and Patricia played, they heard the same praise expressed over and over, sometimes with different levels of eloquence, but always with the same message – this  story spoke to ME.  It is not an accident that Norm Foster is the most produced playwright in Canada and has achieved an international reputation. His craft and interest in the world we actually live in give voice to the many who feel they are rarely heard and it is with great pride that here at The Foster Festival, we enjoy the opportunity to “entertain.”

"Norm Foster creates characters who are so believable that theatregoers see bits of themselves reflected on stage."
-- Los Angeles Daily News

"The measure of Foster's genius, his ability to suck us in with laughter then calmly turn the knife, gives the best of his plays a wildly beating heart."
-- Hamilton Spectator

"Norm Foster is our most-produced playwright for a reason: he's very, very funny."
--Montreal Gazette

Staff: 

Patricia Vanstone - Artistic Director, Co-Founder
Emily Oriold - Executive Director, Co-Founder
Norm Foster - Playwright in Residence, Co-Founder


Hey Kid's, Let's Put On a Show!

  • As a not-for-profit theatre organization, private support and donations cover a significant portion of our annual operating and production costs. It is through this private support that we are able to execute and maintain the vision of The Foster Festival.

  • The Foster Festival is dedicated to producing the finest professional theatre and we want to keep you laughing all summer long, but to put a show on stage requires more than ticket sales. To help us achieve our trademark Humour with Heart, we would like to welcome you as a  Founding Foster Friend with Benefits. Your donations will help fund our productions as well as our commitment to foster new and emerging writers and artists, through workshops and development opportunities. 

  • By donating to the founding of The Foster Festival you will get to be an important part of Canadian cultural history as we create a home for this exciting festival that celebrates Canada's most prolific playwright! Norm Foster is the most produced playwright in the history of the country and he receives, on average, an astounding 150 productions of his plays each year.  It has been said that on any given day of the year, there is a Norm Foster play either in rehearsal or in performance somewhere in the world. 

The Impact

  • While our primary goal is to establish The Foster Festival and program a three-play season celebrating the work of Norm Foster, we also wish to establish a lab in which other Canadian playwrights can pursue their craft in a nurturing environment with the potential for production. We want to “Foster Talent” with an interest in eventually giving their voices a wider audience by serving as an originating producer, providing them a calling card to the wider Canadian theatre community.  The Foster Festival aims to become a national source for programming and to put popular Canadian theatre on the international map.

  • As a theatre dedicated to the work of Norm Foster, we will have the exclusive rights to premiering Norm’s work.  A look at the production statistics over the past five years will illustrate just how significant this is.  Not only will we be providing a wonderful source of entertainment to the people of St. Catharines and the Niagara region but we will also be attracting interest from producers from all over the country who are constantly seeking the kind of programming for which Norm has become famous – highly entertaining yet heartfelt stories that are guaranteed Box Office success.

  • In addition to a lab for other Canadian playwrights to pursue their craft, The Foster Festival will present an annual playwrighting contest each spring for youth writers in the Niagara region who are between the ages of 12 to 17. The top two short comedic plays will be selected and produced with local youth talent with the goal of educating and training the next generation of artists and strengthening the local arts community through participation and education. 

  • The Foster Festival has partnered with the Dramatic Arts Department at Brock University in St. Catharines, ON. We look forward to mentoring and training DART's senior and graduating students to give these emerging theatre artists their first crucial work experience as they train with our top designers, technicians, and artists in a professional environment. 


Can't Spare a Dime? Do Have Time? Become a Foster Volunteer!

  • Volunteering with The Foster Festival is a great way to support the arts and culture of our community. Our volunteers are a vital part of our organization. They advocate for the company, help us greet patrons, sell 50/50 tickets, assist with our outreach programs, and help with Special Fundraising and Community Events. 

  • If volunteering with The Foster Festival is of interest to you, please contact us today! 


Don't Forget to Share!

  • Share with your friends and family! Use the Indiegogo share tools, email a friend, or give someone a call to help us spread the word about The Foster Festival and our crowd funding campaign. Word-of-mouth is the best form of advertising!

How to Donate:



Select your preferred level of donation/perk. ------>
To donate more than the minimum level of each perk, select "additional gift" which you will be able to do when going through the contribution process.
NEW! All Titter donations will receive an autographed picture of Norm Foster.

NEW! All Snicker donations will receive an autographed picture of Norm Foster and an autographed manuscript of one of Norm's plays...of your choosing!

NEW! All Guffaw donations will receive an autographed picture of Norm Foster, a world premiere Norm Foster script autographed by Norm and the cast, and an autographed season poster!

All levels of donations have new added perks, so read through them carefully to ensure you are receiving your preferred perks!

story:
SUMMARY OF OUR CAMPAIGN

    IntenCity Dance project  was a dream of our founder Calvin's for a long time. His dream became a reality when he founded IntenCity dance Project in September of 2014.  Wanting to start small with a handful of founding dancers  and company members to create a family atmosphere where dancers could come to learn, train hard, and be surrounded with positive energy. IntenCity was founded on the basis of learning a professional career while enjoying the world of dance around you and learning from great teachers.

    Our dancers have trained hard and are looking forward to and  are ready for the challenge of nationals. The experience of a week long convention to train with amazing choreographers, the chance to get on that big stage and show everyone their hard work and where they are now. Being a smaller company raising funds isn't as easy and we want our dancers and their families to concentrate on the performance and not the money.

   Your contribution would allow our dancers to fulfill this dream of nationals, for an experience they will remember always. In return we would like to offer you our thanks and gratitude. We have many perks we are ready to give out  as a way of showing our thanks. Please check them out.


 WHAT DO WE NEED??? WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU??


   Realistically  for all of our company members to attend the Nationals convention and competition we would need $7200.00. I began the campaign at $5600 because that would at least cover most of competition costs for our dancers. We would be  ecstatic to   raise well beyond our goal of course.

  We are offering a wide range of  perks for those who help us out. From shout outs on FB and Instagram to baked good, to videos, gifts etc. Please check them out and find one that appeals to you.

 If we do not raise all the money needed we will apply it to the costs and  that will definitely help us get the dancers to the event.


OUR DANCERS WILL MAKE A  POSITIVE IMPACT ON THIS WORLD

  By helping our dancers fulfill their dreams you are enabling them to develop a craft that one day will propel their careers. Dancers learn dedication,commitment, and team work. Here at IntenCity we pride ourselves  the positive impact our dancers are making and will continue to make on our community.

  OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you cant help us with a contribution today  that's Ok we understand!  We of course would love to  have you share our campaign with your friends and family. Visit our FB page and  give us a like and visit often to check out what we are up to. Maybe visit our Instagram and follow us there or give us a shout out.   Wed appreciate anything you can do to help these very talented young people get seen. They want more than anything to show the word  their art.

 Thank you for stopping by.

story:
About our campaign

Victoria Music Ltd. is a registered charity established to provide access for all to the performing arts irrespective of age, artistic ability, physical ability or means to pay.

Our latest production is 'Our House : The Musical', easily our biggest production to date. It stars an entirely amateur cast from all sections of the community who have been brought together in an ambitious undertaking to bring the award-winning Madness musical to Runcorn.

The cast and crew are working incredibly hard, juggling rehearsals with their jobs and family lives. It is a huge ask to do a  five night run as well months of rehearsal, and we want to make sure that they get a live band for the show, to really make it sound professional and supply that party atmosphere that Our House needs!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise £2,500 to pay for professional musicians who are members of the musicians union. This is a requirement of the venue and the license.
  • We are able to offer some fantastic perks that money can't buy, including special VIP audience packages,a private performance by our cast for your event or party, and your business advertised as part of the Our House set! Some of our perks would make great gifts for a birthday or special occasion.
  • If we don't raise the entire amount, we will use all funds to go towards the band.  We would love to have a seven piece band, but even a four piece will give the production the professional boost it needs. The more we raise, the better and bigger the band will be!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can afford to help with gifts of money, but if you still want to support us, why not share the campaign on Facebook, tumblr or twitter? You never know, someone else may be able to help and move us that bit closer to our goal.

If you would prefer to make a contribution without a reward attached,  for charitable purposes, just click on 'make a contribution' and enter the amount.

story:
Short Summary

Anxiety disorders are the most common mental illness in the U.S., affecting 40 million adults in the United States (18% of U.S. population). How do we as a society deal with these mental illnesses and those who suffer from them?  And do we the afflicted have any control?

Because You're Not is a new play I (Nicholas Browne) created during my time at Point Park University with an ensemble of 10 actors. The play follows Aiden: a recent college graduate and struggling writer living in NYC who suffers from anxiety. The audience experiences the drastic change of Aiden's perceived reality as he struggles to stay afloat as a (newly) single, unmotivated, millennial. 

This August Because You're Not is traveling to Charlottetown Canada to participate in the Island Fringe Festival! And we need help! This campaign will help provide props/tech, housing, food and transportation to and from the island for our group of 9 artists.

Nicholas Browne: Director
Alexis Cash: Erin
Evelyn Dumont: Babs
Emily Hin: Movement & Dance Captain/ Merriam
Matthew Menendez: Owen
Nate McVicker: Blake/ Josh
Sarah Robotham: Molly
Alex Walton: Aiden
Julia Warner: Harper


What We Need

We need $3,000
  • $1700 going toward van rental and gas.
  • $500 lodging (We are camping!)
  • $500 for food.
  • $300 for props, costumes, music etc. 

The Impact

But why is supporting this production of the play important?

  • This play explores head on what its like to have anxiety/depression. Two illnesses that are the most diagnosed in the U.S as well as the most stigmatized.
  • This play was created by a young group of passionate artists through improvisation and experimentation which is vital for the state of theater in this country.
  • This festival is going to provide myself and the rest of the artistic team an opportunity to experiment and better the play for further productions.
  •  Its themes are universal and they aim to empower all people to fight for happiness.

    Risks & Challenges

    The main challenge is getting all 9 of us and our gear to the island. The drive is about 15 hours and we are doing it in one big van.  In addition, to save money and stay together we are camping for part of the week.  Fortunately the weather is very

    beautiful during this part of the year and we as a team are thrilled for the opportunity to hunker down and add to our adventure.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand if you cant make a donation at this time but please help us by spreading the word! 
    • Share our link on Facebook or twitter and if you saw the show before let people know why it is important and what you like about it!
    • Also visit our Facebook page to stay tuned about our fundraisers and shows!

story:
This exciting theatre project is a collaboration between award winning 1st Framework and the 3rdthought Arts Collective, London, led by Artistic Director Peter Avery and Producer Maxine Webster. 

This latest project, Turning Point, is set in one of the GDR towns that really suffered when the wall fell in 1989.  It describes how the older generation of East Germans still living there have fared since then and how they react to a young woman returning from a new life far away to celebrate her grandfather's birthday, and her attempt to understand his political past.

Our exciting new translation "Turning Point" (from the German Im Ruecken die Stadt by Thomas Freyer) was originally presented at the Gorki Theatre in Berlin in 2010.  The English translation has been funded through a grant from the Goethe Institute, and is poised to go into rehearsal.  However we now need funds to take this brilliant project to the next stage of production, with performances in London at the end of October 2015. 

(the performance venue Trinity Buoy Wharf, opposite the Millennium Dome)
Our company are well established, seasoned professionals, with full charitable status and governed by a Board of Trustees, and have many years experience of high profile and innovative performances.  They will come to this proposed October 2015 project fresh from an interactive performance and technology production in Berlin in August www.Invisiblepeople.eu.  
The company strongly believe that the staging of this important play will promote a fuller understanding of the experiences of the older generation in East Germany as we mark the 25th anniversary of German reunification.

Previous 1st Framework premieres include Trio in E by Eric Rohmer.  The Company have created many performance projects in collaboration with a wide variety of arts practitioners including : Sydney Carnevale Festival, Berlin Festival, Serpentine Gallery & English National Opera London. 

www.1stframework.org
The funding we raise will go towards actor and crew fees, basic set and costumes and the performance rights for the translated text.  People funding this project will have the unique opportunity to see first hand how the production has been crafted, obtain artwork from the show and to meet the cast at the stunning riverside venue Trinity Buoy Wharf. London E1.
(production photographs by Simon Richards)

(artwork by 1st Framework Artistic Director Peter Avery)

story:
1949: Maggie, an Irish country girl, secretly gives birth to a baby boy and is forced to give him away. 2010: Her journalist daughter discovers a global story on abuse in the Catholic Church is also her family's narrative, and sets out to put flesh on the bones of a past hidden by church, state, media – and shame. Philomena endured a lifetime of separation, Maggie can't face the truth of reunion. A true story of atonement for the sins of others, softened by Irish humour.

Since Maggie went away has been written and will be performed by Jacqueline Nolan.  The show has been directed by Lora Mander.

Background

Since Maggie Went Away is a fictionalised autobiographical piece, which dramatises my Irish family's dark secret. In 2010, I found out I have a brother. Fifty-eight years after a forced separation, he succeeded in tracking my (and his) mother down. Unable to face the truth of his fate at an Irish Catholic home for boys, she died the same year, before they reunited.

This show started as a newspaper article I wrote in 2013 about these events: discovering I have a brother who was abused while I played freely down the road on Dublin streets. Then I travelled back to the Catholic home in Castlepollard where my mother had given birth. I was attracted to the cemetery situated in the grounds, but there on the neatly trimmed lawn – struck by the absence of gravestones – I felt I was standing on a bigger story.

Last year, Amsterdam's leading English-language Orange Tea Theatre approached me about an evening of monologues they were producing. I wrote a 20-minute monologue for the event – set in the cemetery at Castlepollard. By coincidence, the discovery of a mass grave in the west of Ireland in the same month made international headlines.

Ballydam Theatre has been set up to give an artistic voice to greater political issues, to tell the truth behind the facts. It is part of Jacqueline Nolan's acting and writing company, Ballydam Film and Media. 

Orange Tea Theatre (www.orangeteatheatre.com) is a leading English-language theatre company in Amsterdam. Founded in 2011 by Lora Mander and Sam Morris, it focuses on creating new writing. 

Getting us to Edinburgh

Lora and myself are taking the play to Edinburgh's international Fringe Theatre Festival in August. Neither of our theatre companies receives any kind of subsidy. And Edinburgh is an expensive business! As we are based in Amsterdam, we have additional travel and accommodation costs, not to mention an ever-strengthening pound. So we are appealing to you and to your generosity to support us on our journey. Any donation helps: we would be so grateful!

We intend making getting to Edinburgh no matter what.  By donating through Indiegogo, you can help us get there a little faster.  Even better, is that you can still select to support us through the Flexible Funding model, which enables us to keep your donation, regardless of reaching our goal. 

Some Costs Breakdown:

Theatre hire: €1,006

Fringe registration: €238
Travel / accommodation: €2,441

Graphic design and printing: €715

Rehearsal space and preview venue Amsterdam: €510

Crew fees: €423

There's set design, sound editing, a voiceover, insurance, transport of set pieces, advertising, publicity, not to mention food expenses and contingency. I estimate the Edinburgh budget will amount to around €9,000. 

A BIGGER PICTURE

Since Maggie Went Away is the story of so many Irish girls and families. It is ongoing and it is topical, as tens of thousands of adopted and fostered children are still searching for their mothers (and fathers) – many of them in the US – because Irish legislation denies them the right to know who they or their biological parents are.

By helping us get to the Fringe, we have the opportunity to reach a wider audience and spread more acute awareness of the pain that many of these women and families have faced for decades.  

Risks & Challenges

Lora and I  have already invested a lot of time and money into this project.  We realise that if we don't make it, we might have to pay off credit cards for a year! However, this is an important play and story which will make a further impact on our audience and society, and we'll do it no matter what.

Other ways you can help

We know that not everyone can contribute to our cause, but we hope that you will support us other ways, such as sharing our campaign and the information about our performance.  

Additionally, you may wish to attend our first performances in Amsterdam on 20th & 21st of June at Perdu, Kloveniersburgwal 86, Amsterdam.  More information at www.orangeteatheatre.com

See us in Edinburgh!

theSpace @ Surgeons Hall (Venue 53), 11 August, 3.05pm

theSpace on the Mile (Venue 39), 12-15 August, 12.15pm
story_txt:
1949: Maggie, an Irish country girl,
secretly gives birth to a baby boy and is forced to give him away. 2010: Her
journalist daughter discovers a global story on abuse in the Catholic Church is
also her family's narrative, and sets out to put flesh on the bones of a past
hidden by church, state, media – and shame. Philomena endured a lifetime of separation, Maggie can't face the truth
of reunion. A true story of atonement for the sins
of others, softened by Irish humour.Since Maggie went away has been written and will be performed by Jacqueline Nolan.  The show has been directed by Lora Mander.Background

Since Maggie Went Away is a fictionalised autobiographical
piece, which dramatises my
Irish family's dark secret. In 2010, I found out I have a brother. Fifty-eight
years after a forced separation, he succeeded in tracking my (and his) mother
down. Unable to face the truth of his fate at an Irish Catholic home for boys,
she died the same year, before they reunited. 
This show started
as a newspaper article I wrote in 2013 about these events: discovering I have a
brother who was abused while I played freely down the road on Dublin streets. Then
I travelled back to the Catholic home in Castlepollard where my mother had
given birth. I was attracted to the cemetery situated in the grounds, but there
on the neatly trimmed lawn – struck by the absence of gravestones – I felt I
was standing on a bigger story.
Last year, Amsterdam's
leading English-language Orange Tea Theatre approached me about an evening of
monologues they were producing. I wrote a 20-minute monologue for the event – set
in the cemetery at Castlepollard. By coincidence, the discovery of a mass grave
in the west of Ireland in the same month made international headlines. Ballydam Theatre has been set up to give an artistic voice to greater political issues, to tell the truth behind the facts. in August. Neither of our theatre companies receives any kind of subsidy. And
Edinburgh is an expensive business! As we are based in Amsterdam, we have
additional travel and accommodation costs, not to mention an ever-strengthening
pound. So we are appealing to you and to your generosity to support us on our
journey. Any donation helps: we would be so grateful! 
We intend
making getting to Edinburgh no matter what.  By donating through Indiegogo, you can help us get there a little faster.  Even better, is that you can still select to support us through the Flexible Funding model, which enables us to keep your donation, regardless of reaching our goal. Some Costs Breakdown:

Fringe registration: €238
Travel / accommodation: €2,441
Graphic design and printing: €715
Rehearsal space and preview venue Amsterdam: €510
Crew fees: €423
There's set design, sound editing, a voiceover, insurance,
transport of set pieces, advertising, publicity, not to mention food expenses and contingency. I estimate the Edinburgh budget will amount to around €9,000. A BIGGER PICTURESince Maggie Went Away is the story of so many Irish girls and families. It is ongoing and it is topical, as tens of thousands of adopted and fostered children are still searching for their mothers (and fathers) – many of them in the US – because Irish legislation denies them the right to know who they or their biological parents are.By helping us get to the Fringe, we have the opportunity to reach a wider audience and spread more acute awareness of the pain that many of these women and families have faced for decades.  Risks & ChallengesLora and I  have already invested a lot of time and money into this project.  We realise that if we don't make it, we might have to pay off credit cards for a year!
